  4314                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4315                                  ;									:
  4316                                  ;	System initialization						:
  4317                                  ;									:
  4318                                  ;	The entry conditions are established by the bootstrap		:
  4319                                  ;	loader and are considered unknown. The following jobs		:
  4320                                  ;	will be performed by this module:				:
  4321                                  ;									:
  4322                                  ;	1.	All device initialization is performed			:
  4323                                  ;	2.	A local stack is set up and DS:SI are set		:
  4324                                  ;		to point to an initialization table. Then		:
  4325                                  ;		an inter-segment call is made to the first		:
  4326                                  ;		byte of the dos 					:
  4327                                  ;	3.	Once the dos returns from this call the ds		:
  4328                                  ;		register has been set up to point to the start		:
  4329                                  ;		of free memory. The initialization will then		:
  4330                                  ;		load the command program into this area 		:
  4331                                  ;		beginning at 100 hex and transfer control to		:
  4332                                  ;		this program.						:
  4333                                  ;									:
  4334                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4335                                  
  4336                                  ; 01/10/2022
  4337                                  ; 08/01/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4338

  4352 0000158E 00                      fbigfat:	db 0			; flags	for drive
  4353 0000158F 0000                    fatloc:		dw 0			; seg addr of fat sector
  4354 00001591 0000                    init_bootseg:	dw 0			; seg addr of buffer for reading boot record
  4355 00001593 80                      rom_drv_num:	db 80h			; rom drive number
  4356 00001594 0002                    md_sectorsize:	dw 200h			; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  4357 00001596 0000                    temp_cluster:	dw 0			; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  4358 00001598 FFFF                    last_fat_sec_num: dw 0FFFFh		; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  4359

  4361                                  ; call to determine drive parameters.

  4366 0000159C 28                      num_cyln:	db 40			; number of cylinders returned by rom
  4367                                  		;db 0	; 08/08/2023
  4368 0000159D 00                      fakefloppydrv:	db 0			; if 1,	then no	diskette drives	in the system.
  4369                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  4426

  4429                                  ;   resb 1
  4430                                  ;   resw 1 ; 1

  4441                                  ;.size:

  4444                                  ; 08/01/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4445                                  
  4446                                  ; 20/04/2019
  4447                                  
  4448                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0) IO.SYS
  4449                                  
  4450                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4451                                  BPB48T:
  4452                                  ;bpb48t:	; bpbx <512, 2, 1, 2, 112, 720, 0FDh, 2, 9, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0> 
  4453                                  		; 48 tpi diskettes	;
  4454                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4455                                  		db	2		; sectors/allocation unit
  4456                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4457                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4458                                  		dw	112		; number of directory entries
  4459                                  		dw	720 ; 2*9*40	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4460                                  		db	0FDh		; media descriptor
  4461                                  		dw	2		; number of fat sectors
  4462                                  		dw	9		; sectors per track
  4463                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4464                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4465                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4466                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4467                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)					
  4468                                  
  4469                                  		db 90h
  4470                                  ;align 2
  4471                                  BPB96T:
  4472                                  ;bpb96t:	; bpbx <512, 1, 1, 2, 224, 2400, 0F9h, 7, 15, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0> 
  4473                                  		; 96 tpi diskettes	;
  4474                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4475                                  		db	1		; sectors/allocation unit
  4476                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4477                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4478                                  		dw	224		; number of directory entries
  4479                                  		dw	2400 ; 2*15*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4480                                  		db	0F9h		; media descriptor
  4481                                  		dw	7		; number of fat sectors
  4482                                  		dw	15		; sectors per track
  4483                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4484                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4485                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4486                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4487                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4488                                  
  4489                                  		db 90h
  4490                                  ;align 2
  4491                                  BPB35:
  4492                                  ;bpb35:		; bpbx <512, 2, 1, 2, 112, 1440, 0F9h, 3, 9, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0> 
  4493                                  		; 3.5" diskettes - 720 KB ;		
  4494                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4495                                  		db	2		; sectors/allocation unit
  4496                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4497                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4498                                  		dw	112		; number of directory entries
  4499                                  		dw	1440 ; 2*9*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4500                                  		db	0F9h		; media descriptor
  4501                                  		dw	3		; number of fat sectors
  4502                                  		dw	9		; sectors per track
  4503                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4504                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4505                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4506                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4507                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4508                                  
  4509                                  		db 90h
  4510                                  ;align 2
  4511                                  
  4512                                  ;align 2
  4513                                  ;BPB144:
  4514                                  ;bpb144:	; Retro DOS v4.0 feature only !	; 1.44MB diskettes
  4515                                  ;
  4516                                  ;		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4517                                  ;		db	1		; sectors/allocation unit
  4518                                  ;		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4519                                  ;		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4520                                  ;		dw	224		; number of directory entries
  4521                                  ;		dw	2880 ; 2*18*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4522                                  ;		db	0F0h		; media descriptor
  4523                                  ;		dw	9		; number of fat sectors
  4524                                  ;		dw	18		; sectors per track
  4525                                  ;		dw	2		; heads
  4526                                  ;		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4527                                  ;		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4528                                  ;		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4529                                  ;		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4530                                  ;
  4531                                  ;		db 90h
  4532                                  ;align 2
  4533                                  
  4534                                  BPB288:
  4535                                  ;bpb288:	; bpbx <512, 2, 1, 2, 240, 5760, 0F0h, 9, 36, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0>
  4536                                  		; 3.5" diskettes - 2.88 MB ;	 
  4537                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4538                                  		db	2		; sectors/allocation unit
  4539                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4540                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4541                                  		dw	240		; number of directory entries
  4542                                  		dw	5760 ; 2*36*80	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4543                                  		db	0F0h		; media descriptor
  4544                                  		dw	3		; number of fat sectors
  4545                                  		dw	9		; sectors per track
  4546                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4547                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4548                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4549                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4550                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)
  4551                                  
  4552                                  		db 90h			;
  4553                                  ;align 2
  4554                                  
  4555                                  %endif
  4556                                  
  4557                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4558                                  					; align	2
  4559                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4560                                  %if 0
  4561                                  bpbtable:	dw bpb48t		; 48tpi	drives
  4562                                  		dw bpb96t		; 96tpi	drives
  4563                                  		dw bpb35		; 3.5" drives
  4564                                  		dw bpb35		; unused 8" diskette
  4565                                  		dw bpb35		; unused 8" diskette
  4566                                  		dw bpb35		; used for hard	disk
  4567                                  		dw bpb35		; used for tape	drive
  4568                                  		dw bpb35		; FFOTHER
  4569                                  		dw bpb35		; ERIMO
  4570                                  		dw bpb288		; 2.88MB drive
  4571                                  		;

  4573                                  %endif
  4574                                  
  4575                                  ; 13/12/2022
  4576                                  %if 0
  4577                                  BPBTABLE:	dw BPB48T		; 48tpi	drives
  4578                                  		dw BPB96T		; 96tpi	drives
  4579                                  		dw BPB35		; 3.5" drives
  4580                                  		dw BPB35		; unused 8" diskette
  4581                                  		dw BPB35		; unused 8" diskette
  4582                                  		dw BPB35		; used for hard	disk
  4583                                  		dw BPB35		; used for tape	drive

  4586                                  		dw BPB288		; 2.88MB drive

  4592                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4593                                  
  4594                                  ;	entry point to call utility functions in Bios_Code. At this time,
  4595                                  ;	  we aren't doing any A20 switching. During MSINIT time Bios_Code
  4596                                  ;	  will not yet be moved to its final resting place, so we know
  4597                                  ;	  it'll be low.
  4598                                  ;
  4599                                  ;	to use this function, do a "push cs" and load bp with the offset of
  4600                                  ;	  the function you want to call in Bios_Code. This routine will
  4601                                  ;	  push the address of a retf in Bios_Code onto the stack which
  4602                                  ;	  will get executed when the utility function finishes. It will
  4603                                  ;	  then transfer control to Bios_Code:bp using a couple of pushes
  4604                                  ;	  and a retf
  4605                                  
  4606                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4607                                  ;BC_RETF equ bc_retf - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  4608                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4609                                  BC_RETF equ bc_retf
  4610                                  
  4611                                  addr_of_bcretf:	;dw 0C8h		; dw bc_retf
  4612                                  					; 2C7h:0C8h = 70h:2638h
  4613 0000161F [CA00]                  		dw BC_RETF
  4614                                  
  4615                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4616                                  
  4617                                  call_bios_code:	; proc far			
  4618 00001621 2EFF36[1F16]            		push	word [cs:addr_of_bcretf] 
  4619                                  					; set up near return to far return
  4620 00001626 2EFF36[BF06]            		push	word [cs:cdev+2] ; push Bios_Code segment
  4621 0000162B 55                      		push	bp		; save offset of utility function
  4622 0000162C CB                      		retf			; far jump to (DOS)BIOS code
  4623                                  
  4624                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4625                                  
  4626 0000162D 00                      flp_drvs:	db 0			
  4627                                  
  4628                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4629                                  
  4630                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4631                                  
  4632                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4633                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4634                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4635                                  
  4636                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4637                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4638                                  		;=============================================================
  4639                                  		;
  4640                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4641                                  		;
  4642                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4643                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4644                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4645                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4646                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4647                                  
  4648                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4649                                  		;=============================================================
  4650                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4651                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4652                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4653                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4654                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4655                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4656                                  		
  4657 0000162E FA                      		cli
  4658                                  
  4659                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4660                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4661                                  		;push	ax
  4662                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4663                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4664                                  		;pop	ax
  4665                                  	
  4666                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4667                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4668                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4669                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4670                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4671                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4672                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4673                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4674                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4675                                  
  4676                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4677                                  
  4678                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4679                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4680                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4681                                  
  4682 0000162F 2EA3[8A15]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4683 00001633 2E891E[8815]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4684                                  
  4685                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4686                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4687                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4688                                  
  4689 00001638 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4690 00001639 07                      		pop	es
  4691 0000163A 51                      		push	cx
  4692 0000163B 57                      		push	di
  4693                                  
  4694                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4695                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4696                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4697                                  		; ds = cs
  4698 0000163C 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4699 0000163E 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4700                                  		; ds = 0
  4701                                  
  4702 00001640 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4703                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4704                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4705                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4706 00001642 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4707                                  next_int_:		
  4708 00001645 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4709 00001646 AC                      		lodsb		
  4710                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4711 00001647 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4712 00001648 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4713 0000164A D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4714 0000164C 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4715 0000164E 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4716                                  					; saving address in di
  4717                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4718                                  		;stosw
  4719                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4720                                  		;stosw			; save the vector
  4721                                  		; 28/09/2023
  4722 00001650 A5                      		movsw
  4723 00001651 A5                      		movsw
  4724                                  
  4725 00001652 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4726 00001654 E2EF                    		loop	next_int_
  4727 00001656 5F                      		pop	di
  4728 00001657 59                      		pop	cx
  4729                                  
  4730                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4731                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4732                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4733                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4734                                  
  4735                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4736                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4737                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4738                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4739                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4740                                  
  4741                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4742 00001658 C7064C00[4F07]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4743                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4744                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4745 0000165E 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4746                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4747 00001662 C7065400[FE07]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4748                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4749                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4750 00001668 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4751                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4752 0000166C C7066400[BE07]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4753                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4754                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4755 00001672 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4756                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4757                                  
  4758                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4759 00001676 0E                      		push	cs
  4760 00001677 1F                      		pop	ds
  4761                                  		
  4762 00001678 A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4763 0000167B A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4764 0000167E A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4765 00001681 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4766                                  					; ;
  4767 00001684 FB                      		sti
  4768 00001685 CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4769                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4770                                  
  4771                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4772                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4773                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4774                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4775                                  ;
  4776                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4777                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4778                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4779                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4780                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4781                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4782                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4783                                  
  4784                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4785                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4786                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4787                                  ;
  4788                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4789                                  ; to do anything special.
  4790                                  ;
  4791                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4792                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4793                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4794                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4795                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4796                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4797                                  
  4798                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4799 00001687 A801                    		test	al, 1
  4800                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4801 00001689 752C                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4802                                  
  4803                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4804                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4805                                  ;
  4806                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4807                                  ;
  4808                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4809                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4810                                  
  4811 0000168B 50                      		push	ax
  4812 0000168C 53                      		push	bx
  4813 0000168D 51                      		push	cx
  4814 0000168E 52                      		push	dx
  4815 0000168F 57                      		push	di
  4816 00001690 06                      		push	es
  4817 00001691 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4818 00001693 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4819 00001695 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4820                                  					; DL = drive number
  4821                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4822                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4823                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4824 00001697 7204                    		jb	short _gdskp_error
  4825                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4826                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4827                                  		; ds = cs
  4828 00001699 8816[2D16]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4829                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4830 0000169D 07                      		pop	es
  4831 0000169E 5F                      		pop	di
  4832 0000169F 5A                      		pop	dx
  4833 000016A0 59                      		pop	cx
  4834 000016A1 5B                      		pop	bx
  4835 000016A2 58                      		pop	ax
  4836 000016A3 7212                    		jb	short normalfloppydrv
  4837                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4838                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4839                                  
  4840                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4841                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4842                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4843                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4844 000016A5 A0[2D16]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4845 000016A8 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4846 000016AA 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4847                                  
  4848                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4849                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4850 000016AC 48                      		dec	ax
  4851 000016AD EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4852                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4853                                  
  4854                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4855                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4856 000016AF B80100                  		mov	ax, 1			
  4857 000016B2 A2[9D15]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  4858                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4859                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4860                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4861 000016B5 EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4862                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4863                                  
  4864                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4865 000016B7 D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4866 000016B9 D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4867                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4868                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4869                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4870 000016BB 2403                    		and	al, 3
  4871 000016BD 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4872 000016BF 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4873                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4874                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4875                                  		; ds = cs
  4876 000016C0 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  4877                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  4878                                  notsingle:				
  4879 000016C4 40                      		inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  4880                                  					; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  4881                                  					; booted off hard file
  4882 000016C5 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4883                                  
  4884                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4885                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4886                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4887                                  BRKADR	 EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  4888                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt
  4889                                  DSKADR	EQU	1EH * 4	; address of ptr to disk parameters
  4890                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters
  4891                                  CHROUT	EQU	29h
  4892                                  LSTDRV	EQU     504h
  4893                                  
  4894                                  ; determine whether we booted from floppy or hard disk...
  4895                                  
  4896 000016C7 F6C280                  		test	dl, 80h		; boot from floppy ?
  4897 000016CA 7502                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.
  4898 000016CC 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; indicate boot	from drive a
  4899                                  gothrd:

  5204                                  ;	the indications are as follows:

  5249                                  
  5250                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  5251                                  ; diskette drives:
  5252                                  ;
  5253                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  5254                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  5255                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  5256                                  ;
  5257                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  5258                                  ;
  5259                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  5260                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  5261                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  5262                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)
  5263                                  					
  5264 00001845 30D2                    		xor	dl, dl
  5265                                  
  5266                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5267                                  		; ds = cs
  5268                                  		;push	cs
  5269                                  		;pop	ds
  5270                                  
  5271 00001847 C606[2C01]09            		mov	byte [eot], 9
  5272 0000184C BF[1901]                		mov	di, start_bds 	; if we	are faking floppy drives we need
  5273                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives
  5274                                  
  5275                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  5276                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  5277                                  
  5278                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5279                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5280                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5281                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5282                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5283                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5284                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5285                                  ; the bds for harddrives.
  5286                                  
  5287 0000184F 803E[9D15]01            		cmp	byte [fakefloppydrv], 1
  5288 00001854 750B                    		jnz	short loop_drive
  5289 00001856 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5290                                  					; di <-	first bds link
  5291 00001858 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5292                                  					; di <-	second bds link
  5293 0000185A C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; set end of link
  5294 0000185E E90F01                  		jmp	dohard		; allocate/initialise bds for harddrives

  5580                                  ; if more than 2 diskette drives on the system, then it is necessary to remap
  5581                                  ; the bds chain to adjust the logical drive num (drive letter) with greater
  5582                                  ; than two diskette drives
  5583                                  ;
  5584                                  ; new scheme:	if more than 2 disktte drives, first map the bds structure
  5585                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5586                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5587                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5588                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5589                                  ;		drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.

  5601                                  
  5602                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5603                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5604                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5605                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5606                                  ;
  5607                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5608                                  ;
  5609                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5610                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5611                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5612                                  ;use to start with.
  5613                                  ;
  5614                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5615                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5616                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5617                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5618                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5619                                  
  5620                                  ; -- begin changed section
  5621                                  ;
  5622                                  ;   1.	 basic configuration for msbio (endfloppy)

  5624                                  ;   3.	 end of bdss	; end of bdss for hard disks

  5626                                  ;   5.	 endcmosclockset;supporting program for cmos clock write.

  5687                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5688                                  
  5689                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  5690                                  ;
  5691                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5692                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5693                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5694                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5695                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5696                                  ; off of it.
  5697                                  ;
  5698                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5699                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5700                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5701                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  5702                                  ; when to install the hook.
  5703                                  
  5704                                  ;checkcmosclock:
  5705                                  ; 02/10/2022				
  5706                                  checkcompaqbug:
  5707                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5708                                  		; es = 0F000h
  5709                                  		;mov	ax, 0F000h	; point	to ROM BIOS
  5710                                  		;mov	es, ax
  5711

  5997                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  5998                                  
  5999                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  6000                                  ;
  6001                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  6002                                  
  6003                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  6004                                  
  6005                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6006                                  ; module name: remap
  6007                                  ;
  6008                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  6009                                  ;
  6010                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  6011                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  6012                                  ;
  6013                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  6014                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  6015                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  6016                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  6017                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  6018                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  6019                                  
  6020                                  ; input:       none
  6021                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  6022                                  ; exit error:  none
  6023                                  ; called from: msinit
  6024                                  ;
  6025                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  6026                                  ;	  found in the system
  6027                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  6028                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  6029                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  6030                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  6031                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  6032                                  ;
  6033                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6034                                  
  6035                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6036                                  ; 02/10/2022
  6037                                  
  6038                                  remap:		; proc near		
  6039 00001B0C 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  6040                                  
  6041                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  6042                                  
  6043                                  drive_loop:				
  6044 00001B11 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6045                                  					; first	hard disk??
  6046 00001B15 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  6047 00001B17 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6048                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  6049 00001B19 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  6050 00001B1C 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  6051 00001B1E EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  6052                                  
  6053                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6054                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  6055                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  6056                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6057                                  
  6058                                  fdrv_found:				
  6059 00001B20 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  6060                                  fdrv_loop:				
  6061 00001B22 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6062                                  					; found	??
  6063 00001B25 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6064                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  6065                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  6066                                  		; 18/12/2022
  6067 00001B27 40                      		inc	ax
  6068 00001B28 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ??
  6069 00001B2B 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk	drives
  6070                                  
  6071                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6072                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  6073                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  6074                                  ; any more.
  6075                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6076                                  
  6077 00001B2D 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  6078                                  					; get first bds
  6079 00001B32 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6080                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  6081 00001B34 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  6082 00001B39 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  6083                                  remap_loop1:				
  6084 00001B3C 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6085                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  6086 00001B3E 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6087 00001B41 FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  6088 00001B43 FECC                    		dec	ah		; count	down extra floppies
  6089 00001B45 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  6090                                  
  6091                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  6092                                  
  6093 00001B47 2EA0[8615]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  6094 00001B4B 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  6095 00001B4D 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  6096 00001B4F 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  6097 00001B54 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  6098                                  
  6099                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  6100                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  6101                                  
  6102 00001B56 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  6103 00001B58 EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  6104                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6105                                  
  6106                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  6107                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  6108                                  
  6109                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  6110 00001B5A 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  6111                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  6112 00001B5F 2EA2[8615]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  6113 00001B63 FEC0                    		inc	al
  6114 00001B65 1E                      		push	ds
  6115 00001B66 BF4404                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  6116                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  6117 00001B69 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  6118 00001B6B A2[9802]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  6119                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  6120                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  6121 00001B6E 1F                      		pop	ds
  6122                                  rmap_exit:				
  6123 00001B6F C3                      		retn
  6124                                  
  6125                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6126                                  
  6127                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6128                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  6129                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  6130                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  6131                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  6132                                  ;**************************************************
  6133                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  6134                                  ;
  6135                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  6136                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  6137                                  ;
  6138                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  6139                                  ;**************************************************
  6140                                  
  6141                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6142                                  bootbias equ 200h
  6143                                  
  6144                                  getboot:	; proc near		
  6145                                  		
  6146                                  		; 08/04/2018
  6147                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  6148                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  6149                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6150                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  6151                                  
  6152 00001B70 2EA1[9115]              		mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  6153 00001B74 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  6154                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6155 00001B76 BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  6156                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  6157                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  6158 00001B79 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6159 00001B7C 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  6160 00001B7E B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  6161 00001B81 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6162                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6163                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6164                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6165 00001B83 7209                    		jb	short erret
  6166                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6167 00001B85 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  6168                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  6169                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  6170 00001B8C 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  6171                                  erret:					
  6172 00001B8E F9                      		stc
  6173                                  norm_ret:				
  6174 00001B8F C3                      		retn
  6175                                  
  6176                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6177                                  
  6178                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  6179                                  
  6180                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6181                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  6182                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  6183                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  6184                                  ;   determine version number
  6185                                  ;
  6186                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  6187                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  6188                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  6189                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  6190                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  6191                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  6192                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  6193                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6194                                  
  6195                                  sethard:	; proc near
  6196                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6197                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  6198 00001B90 57                      		push	di
  6199 00001B91 53                      		push	bx
  6200                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 12/08/2023
  6201 00001B92 06                      		push	es
  6202 00001B93 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6203 00001B96 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6204 00001B99 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  6205                                  					; fnon_removable
  6206 00001B9D C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  6207                                  					; ffHardFile
  6208 00001BA1 C606[8E15]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  6209 00001BA6 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  6210 00001BA8 52                      		push	dx
  6211 00001BA9 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  6212 00001BAB CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  6213                                  					; DL = drive number
  6214                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  6215                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  6216                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  6217 00001BAD FEC6                    		inc	dh
  6218 00001BAF 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  6219 00001BB2 5A                      		pop	dx
  6220 00001BB3 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  6221 00001BB5 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  6222 00001BB8 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6223 00001BBB 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  6224 00001BBC E8B1FF                  		call	getboot
  6225 00001BBF 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  6226 00001BC0 7256                    		jb	short setret
  6227 00001BC2 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6228                                  
  6229                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  6230                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  6231                                  
  6232                                  act_part:
  6233 00001BC5 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  6234 00001BCA 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  6235 00001BCC 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  6236 00001BD0 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6237 00001BD2 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6238 00001BD6 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6239 00001BD8 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6240 00001BDC 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  6241                                  got_good_act:				; 11/08/2023
  6242 00001BDE 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  6243                                  					; (0 = first primary dos or active partition)
  6244 00001BE0 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  6245 00001BE2 FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6246                                  no_act:					
  6247 00001BE4 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6248 00001BE7 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6249                                  					; last entry done?
  6250 00001BEB 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6251 00001BED BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6252                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6253                                  
  6254                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6255                                  
  6256                                  get_primary:
  6257 00001BF0 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6258 00001BF5 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6259                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6260 00001BF7 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6261 00001BFB 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  6262 00001BFD 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6263 00001C01 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  6264 00001C03 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6265 00001C07 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  6266                                  got_prim:
  6267 00001C09 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6268 00001C0B 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6269 00001C0D FECE                    		dec	dh
  6270                                  not_prim:
  6271 00001C0F 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6272 00001C12 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6273 00001C16 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6274                                  setret:					
  6275 00001C18 F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6276 00001C19 E99A02                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6277                                  
  6278                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6279                                  
  6280                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6281                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6282                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6283                                  ;
  6284                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6285                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6286                                  ;  without change.
  6287                                  ;
  6288                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6289                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6290                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6291                                  
  6292                                  set2:		
  6293                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6294                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  6295 00001C1C 8816[9315]              		mov	[rom_drv_num], dl
  6296                                  		;mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  6297                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  6298 00001C20 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6299 00001C24 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  6300                                  
  6301                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  6302                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  6303                                  
  6304 00001C28 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6305 00001C2B 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6306 00001C2E 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  6307 00001C32 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  6308 00001C36 7305                    		jnb	short okdrive
  6309 00001C38 800E[8E15]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  6310                                  okdrive:
  6311 00001C3D 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]
  6312 00001C41 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6313                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  6314 00001C44 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]
  6315 00001C48 894519                  		mov	[di+19h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6316 00001C4B 268B570A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+10]	; # of sectors (high)
  6317 00001C4F 268B4708                		mov	ax, [es:bx+8]	; # of sectors (low)
  6318 00001C53 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6319 00001C56 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6320                                  					; bpb->maxsec =	p->partitionlength
  6321 00001C59 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  6322 00001C5C 7705                    		ja	short okdrive_1
  6323 00001C5E 83F840                  		cmp	ax, 64		; if (p->partitionlength < 64)
  6324 00001C61 72B5                    		jb	short setret	; return -1;
  6325                                  okdrive_1:
  6326 00001C63 8B5519                  		mov	dx, [di+19h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6327 00001C66 8B4517                  		mov	ax, [di+17h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6328 00001C69 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; boot sector number - for mini	disk
  6329                                  					; usually equal	to the # of sec/trk.
  6330 00001C6B 8A5D13                  		mov	bl, [di+13h]	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6331 00001C6E 50                      		push	ax
  6332 00001C6F 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  6333 00001C71 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6334 00001C73 F7F3                    		div	bx		; (sectors)dx:ax / (BDS.secpertrack)bx =
  6335                                  					; (track)temp_h:ax + (sector)dx
  6336                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6337                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6338                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6339 00001C75 A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
  6340 00001C78 58                      		pop	ax
  6341 00001C79 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6342 00001C7B 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  6343 00001C7D FEC1                    		inc	cl
  6344 00001C7F 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  6345 00001C81 8A5D15                  		mov	bl, [di+15h]	; [di+BDS.heads]
  6346 00001C84 50                      		push	ax
  6347 00001C85 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6348                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:temp_h]
  6349 00001C87 A1[2105]                		mov	ax, [temp_h] ; 12/08/2023
  6350 00001C8A F7F3                    		div	bx
  6351                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6352 00001C8C A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax ; 12/08/2023
  6353 00001C8F 58                      		pop	ax
  6354 00001C90 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dl is head, ax is cylinder
  6355                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6356 00001C92 833E[2105]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
  6357                                  		;cmp	word [cs:temp_h], 0
  6358 00001C97 775F                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6359 00001C99 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024
  6360 00001C9C 775A                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6361                                  			; Retro DOS v3.2 note by Erdogan Tan - 28/07/2019
  6362                                  			; **MSDOS code accepts if ax = 1024 but it is nonsense here
  6363                                  			; ('ja' must be 'jnb')
  6364                                  okdrive_2:
  6365                                   		; 28/07/2019
  6366                                  ; dl is head.
  6367                                  ; ax is cylinder
  6368                                  ; cl is sector number (assume less than 2**6 = 64 for int 13h)
  6369                                  
  6370                                  ;*** for mini disks ***
  6371                                  
  6372 00001C9E 837D4701                		cmp	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  6373                                  					; check for mini disk
  6374 00001CA2 7503                    		jnz	short oknotmini	; not mini disk.
  6375 00001CA4 034549                  		add	ax, [di+49h]	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  6376                                  					; set the physical track number
  6377                                  oknotmini:
  6378                                  ;*** end of added logic for mini disk
  6379                                  				
  6380 00001CA7 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; move high two bits of cyl to high
  6381 00001CA9 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; two bits of upper byte
  6382 00001CAB 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; turn off remainder of bits
  6383 00001CAE 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; move two bits to correct spot
  6384 00001CB0 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch iscylinder (low 8 bits)
  6385                                  					; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6386 00001CB2 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; dh is	head
  6387                                  		
  6388                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6389 00001CB4 8A16[9315]              		mov	dl, [rom_drv_num]
  6390                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:rom_drv_num] ; dl is drive number
  6391                                  
  6392                                  ; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6393                                  ; ch is low 8 bits of cylinder
  6394                                  ; dh is head
  6395                                  ; dl is drive
  6396                                  
  6397                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6398                                  ; into cs:disksector area.
  6399                                  
  6400                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  6401                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.
  6402                                  
  6403 00001CB8 0E                      		push	cs
  6404 00001CB9 07                      		pop	es
  6405 00001CBA BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; for convenience,
  6406                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6407                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  6408 00001CBD B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6409 00001CC0 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6410                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6411                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6412                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6413                                  
  6414                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  6415                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  6416                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.
  6417                                  
  6418                                  		; 11/08/2023
  6419                                  		;mov	bx, disksector	; BIOSDATA:014Eh ; MSDOS 6.21 ; 11/08/2023
  6420                                  					; BIOSDATA:0152h ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  6421 00001CC2 53                      		push	bx
  6422 00001CC3 50                      		push	ax
  6423                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6424                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment ('disksector:' is in BIOSDATA) 
  6425 00001CC4 803FE9                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0E9h
  6426                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0E9h ; is it a near jump?
  6427 00001CC7 740B                    		jz	short check_1_ok ; yes
  6428 00001CC9 803FEB                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0EBh
  6429                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0EBh ; is it a short jump?
  6430 00001CCC 7525                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no
  6431 00001CCE 807F0290                		cmp	byte [bx+2], 90h
  6432                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+2], 90h ; yes, is the next one a nop?
  6433 00001CD2 751F                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid bs ; 11/08/2023
  6434                                  check_1_ok:
  6435                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6436 00001CD4 BB[5901]                		mov	bx, disksector+11 ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6437                                  		;mov	bx, 159h	; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6438                                  					; point to the bpb in the boot record
  6439                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+10]	; [bx+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  6440 00001CD7 8A470A                  		mov	al, [bx+10] ; 12/08/2023 
  6441                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte
  6442 00001CDA 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h	; mask off low nibble
  6443 00001CDC 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  6444 00001CDE 7513                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid boot record
  6445                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx], 512 ; [bx+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  6446 00001CE0 813F0002                		cmp	word [bx], 512 ; 12/08/2023
  6447 00001CE4 750D                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  6448                                  
  6449                                  check2_ok:				; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  6450 00001CE6 8A4702                  		mov	al, [bx+2] ; 12/08/2023
  6451                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+2]	; now make sure that
  6452                                  					; the sectorspercluster is
  6453                                  					; a power of 2
  6454                                  					;
  6455                                  					; [bx+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  6456                                  					; get the sectorspercluster
  6457 00001CE9 08C0                    		or	al, al		; is it zero?
  6458 00001CEB 7406                    		jz	short invalid_boot_record ; yes, invalid boot record
  6459                                  
  6460                                  ck_power_of_two:
  6461 00001CED D0E8                    		shr	al, 1		; shift until first bit emerges
  6462 00001CEF 73FC                    		jnb	short ck_power_of_two
  6463 00001CF1 740B                    		jz	short valid_boot_record
  6464                                  
  6465                                  invalid_boot_record:
  6466 00001CF3 58                      		pop	ax
  6467 00001CF4 5B                      		pop	bx
  6468 00001CF5 E90901                  		jmp	unknown		; jump to invalid boot record
  6469                                  					; unformatted or illegal media.
  6470                                  
  6471                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6472                                  	; 12/08/2023
  6473                                  setret_brdg:
  6474 00001CF8 E91DFF                  		jmp	setret
  6475                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6476                                  
  6477                                  unknown3_0_j:
  6478 00001CFB E90701                  		jmp	unknown3_0	; legally formatted media,
  6479                                  					; although, content might be bad.
  6480                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6481                                  
  6482                                  valid_boot_record:
  6483 00001CFE 58                      		pop	ax
  6484 00001CFF 5B                      		pop	bx
  6485                                  
  6486                                  ; Signature found. Now check version.
  6487                                  
  6488                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6489 00001D00 817F08322E              		cmp	word [bx+8], '2.'

  6982                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32) {

  7168                                  ; the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the various form factors

  7256 00001F75 7405                    		jz	short __@@	; yes, 224 root	entries	is enuf
  7257 00001F77 C7452DF000              		mov	word [di+2Dh], 240 ; [di+BDS.rdirentries]
  7258                                  __@@:					
  7259 00001F7C 885529                  		mov	[di+29h], dl	; [di+BDS.rsecperclus]

  7311 00001FAA 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; -1
