 13884                                  
 13885                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13886                                  ;
 13887                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13888                                  ;
 13889                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13890                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13891                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13892                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13893                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13894                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13895                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13896                                  ;
 13897                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13898                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13899                                  ;
 13900                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13901                                  
 13902                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13903                                  HMAPtr:
 13904 0000143B 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13905                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13906 00001440 8B3E[9608]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13907                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13908 00001444 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13909 00001447 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13910 00001449 803E[9C08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13911                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13912 0000144E 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13913 00001450 FF1E[9808]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13914                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13915 00001454 8B3E[9608]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13916                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13917                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13918 00001458 C3                      		retn
 13919                                  
 13920                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13921                                  
 13922                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13923                                  
 13924                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13925                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13926                                  
 13927                                  move_sector:
 13928                                  
 13929                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13930                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13931                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13932                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13933                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13934                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13935                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13936                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13937                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13938                                  ;
 13939                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13940                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13941                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13942                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13943                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13944                                  
 13945 00001459 FC                      		cld
 13946 0000145A 51                      		push	cx
 13947 0000145B B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13948 0000145E 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13949 00001462 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13950 00001464 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13951 00001468 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13952 0000146A F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13953 0000146C 59                      		pop	cx
 13954 0000146D C3                      		retn
 13955                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13956                                  
 13957                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13958 0000146E D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13959 00001470 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13960 00001472 59                      		pop	cx
 13961 00001473 C3                      		retn
 13962                                  
 13963                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13964                                  
 13965                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13966                                  
 13967                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13968                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13969                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13970                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13971                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13972                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13973                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13974                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13975                                  ;
 13976                                  ; input conditions:
 13977                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13978                                  ;
 13979                                  ; output:
 13980                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13981                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13982                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13983                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13984                                  
 13985                                  check_wrap:	
 13986 00001474 50                      		push	ax
 13987 00001475 53                      		push	bx
 13988 00001476 06                      		push	es
 13989 00001477 57                      		push	di
 13990 00001478 E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13991 0000147B 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13992                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13993 0000147D 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13994                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13995 00001482 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13996 00001484 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13997 00001488 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13998 0000148A 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13999 0000148D 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14000 0000148F 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14001 00001491 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14002                                  
 14003                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14004                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14005                                  
 14006 00001493 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14007 00001495 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14008                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14009 00001497 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14010 00001498 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14011                                  					; if on	boundary
 14012                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14013                                  not_on_bound:
 14014 0000149A 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14015 0000149D 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14016 0000149F 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14017 000014A1 40                      		inc	ax
 14018 000014A2 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14019 000014A4 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14020                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14021 000014A7 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14022 000014AB 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14023                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14024                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14025 000014AD 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14026 000014AF 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14027 000014B0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14028                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14029 000014B2 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14030                                  
 14031                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14032                                  
 14033 000014B4 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14034 000014B6 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14035 000014B8 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14036                                  
 14037                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14038                                  
 14039 000014BA 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14040 000014BC 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14041 000014BE 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14042                                  no_head_bound:				
 14043 000014BF 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14044 000014C1 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14045 000014C2 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14046 000014C4 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14047 000014C6 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14048 000014C8 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14049 000014CB B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14050 000014CD 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14051 000014CF D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14052 000014D1 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14053 000014D3 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14054 000014D5 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14055 000014D7 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14056 000014D9 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14057                                  no_wrap:				
 14058 000014DB F8                      		clc
 14059 000014DC 5F                      		pop	di
 14060 000014DD 07                      		pop	es
 14061 000014DE 5B                      		pop	bx
 14062 000014DF 58                      		pop	ax
 14063 000014E0 C3                      		retn
 14064                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14065                                  
 14066                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14067 000014E1 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14068 000014E3 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14069 000014E5 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14070                                  
 14071                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14072                                  
 14073                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14074                                  
 14075                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14076                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14077                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14078                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14079                                  ;
 14080                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14081                                  
 14082                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14083                                  find_bds:	
 14084 000014E7 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14085                                  fbds_1:					
 14086 000014EB 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14087 000014EF 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14088 000014F1 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14089                                  					; go to next bds
 14090 000014F4 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14091 000014F7 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14092 000014F9 F9                      		stc
 14093                                  fdbs_2:					
 14094 000014FA C3                      		retn
 14095                                  
 14096                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14097                                  
 14098                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14099                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14100                                  doint:
 14101                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14102 000014FB 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14103                                  					; get physical drive number
 14104                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14105                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14106                                  		
 14107 000014FE 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14108 00001500 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14109 00001502 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14110                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14111 00001504 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14112                                  					; get request code
 14113                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14114 00001507 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14115                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14116 0000150A 9D                      		popf
 14117                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14118                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14119 0000150B 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14120                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14121                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14122 00001510 9C                      		pushf
 14123                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14124 00001511 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14125                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14126                                  dointdone:				
 14127 00001514 C3                      		retn
 14128                                  
 14129                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14130                                  
 14131                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14132                                  
 14133                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14134                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14135                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14136                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14137                                  ;
 14138                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14139                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14140                                  ;
 14141                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14142                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14143                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14144                                  
 14145                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14146                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14147                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14148                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14149                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14150                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14151                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14152                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14153                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14154                                  ;end struc
 14155                                  
 14156                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14157                                  
 14158                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14159                                  ;	ah = function
 14160                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14161                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14162                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14163                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14164                                  ;   output conditions:
 14165                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14166                                  
 14167                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14168                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14169                                  ;
 14170                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14171                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14172                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14173                                  
 14174                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14175                                  
 14176                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14177                                  
 14178 00001515 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14179                                  
 14180                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14181                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14182                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14183                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14184                                  
 14185                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14186                                  
 14187                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14188                                  
 14189                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14190                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14191                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14192                                  
 14193                                  format_special_stuff:			
 14194 00001519 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 14195 0000151E 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14196 00001520 53                      		push	bx
 14197 00001521 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14198 00001524 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14199 00001527 5B                      		pop	bx
 14200 00001528 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14201                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14202                                  
 14203                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14204                                  
 14205                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 14206                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 14207                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 14208                                  
 14209                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14210                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 14211 0000152A 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 14212 0000152C 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 14213 0000152E 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 14214 0000152F 51                      		push	cx
 14215 00001530 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 14216 00001532 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 14217 00001534 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 14218 00001536 8406[2905]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 14219 0000153A 59                      		pop	cx
 14220 0000153B 58                      		pop	ax
 14221 0000153C 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14222                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 14223 0000153E 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 14224 0000153F 06                      		push	es
 14225                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14226 00001540 2EC41E[1515]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 14227                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 14228                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 14229 00001545 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 14230 00001547 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 14231 0000154A 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 14232                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 14233                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 14234 0000154E 07                      		pop	es
 14235 0000154F 5B                      		pop	bx
 14236 00001550 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14237                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14238                                  
 14239                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14240                                  
 14241                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 14242                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 14243                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 14244                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 14245                                  
 14246                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 14247 00001552 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 14248                                  					; read driver parm ?
 14249 00001557 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 14250 00001559 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 14251                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14252 0000155E 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14253                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 14254 00001560 50                      		push	ax
 14255 00001561 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14256                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14257                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14258 00001563 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14259                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 14260                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14261 00001568 58                      		pop	ax
 14262 00001569 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14263                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14264                                  
 14265                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14266                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14267                                  
 14268                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 14269                                  
 14270                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14271                                  
 14272                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14273                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14274                                  
 14275                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14276 0000156B 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 14277                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14278                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 14279 0000156C 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14280                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14281                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14282                                  
 14283                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14284                                  
 14285 00001571 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14286 00001574 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14287 00001577 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 14288                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14289                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 14290 00001579 803E[2905]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14291 0000157E 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14292                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14293                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14294                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 14295 00001580 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14296                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14297                                  		
 14298 00001585 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14299                                  		
 14300 00001586 803E[3606]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 14301                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14302 0000158B 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14303                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14304                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 14305 0000158D 9D                      		popf
 14306 0000158E 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14307                                  ret_from_i13:				
 14308 00001590 1F                      		pop	ds
 14309 00001591 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14310                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14311                                  
 14312                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14313                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14314                                  ; a changeline error.
 14315                                  
 14316                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 14317 00001594 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14318                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14319 00001596 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14320 00001599 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14321 0000159B 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14322 0000159D 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14323 0000159F 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14324 000015A4 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14325                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14326                                  					; never	would
 14327 000015A6 53                      		push	bx
 14328 000015A7 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14329 000015AA E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14330 000015AD 5B                      		pop	bx
 14331                                  int13b:					
 14332 000015AE F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14333 000015AF EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14334                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14335                                  
 14336                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14337                                  
 14338                                  goterr13:				
 14339 000015B1 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14340 000015B4 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14341                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 14342 000015B6 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14343 000015B9 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14344 000015BB 803E[3006]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14345 000015C0 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14346                                  
 14347 000015C2 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14348                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14349                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14350                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14351 000015C7 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14352                                  
 14353 000015C9 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14354                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14355                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14356 000015CB 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14357                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14358                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14359 000015D0 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14360 000015D3 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14361 000015D5 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14362 000015D7 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14363 000015D9 53                      		push	bx
 14364 000015DA 51                      		push	cx
 14365 000015DB 52                      		push	dx
 14366 000015DC A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14367                                  loop_ecc:				
 14368 000015DF B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14369                                  
 14370                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14371                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14372                                  ;
 14373                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14374                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14375                                  ; track.
 14376                                  ;
 14377                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14378                                  ; this request.
 14379                                  ;
 14380                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14381                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14382                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14383                                  ;
 14384 000015E2 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14385                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14386                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14387 000015E5 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14388                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14389 000015EA 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14390 000015EC 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14391 000015EF 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14392 000015F1 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14393 000015F4 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14394                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14395                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14396                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14397 000015F6 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14398                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14399                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14400                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14401                                  ok11_op:				
 14402 000015F8 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14403 000015FC 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14404 000015FE FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14405                                  					; add 200h to address
 14406 00001600 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14407 00001602 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14408 00001604 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14409                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14410                                  
 14411                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14412                                  
 14413                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 14414 00001606 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14415                                  ok11_exit:				
 14416 00001607 5A                      		pop	dx
 14417 00001608 59                      		pop	cx
 14418 00001609 5B                      		pop	bx
 14419 0000160A EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14420                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14421                                  
 14422                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14423                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14424                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14425                                  
 14426                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 14427 0000160C 06                      		push	es
 14428 0000160D 53                      		push	bx
 14429 0000160E BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14430 00001611 1E                      		push	ds
 14431 00001612 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14432 00001613 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14433                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14434                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14435 00001616 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14436                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14437 0000161B 5B                      		pop	bx
 14438 0000161C 07                      		pop	es
 14439 0000161D 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14440 0000161F 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14441 00001622 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14442                                  
 14443                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14444                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14445                                  
 14446                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 14447 00001624 56                      		push	si
 14448 00001625 57                      		push	di
 14449 00001626 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14450 00001628 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14451 0000162B E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14452 0000162E 5F                      		pop	di
 14453 0000162F 5E                      		pop	si
 14454 00001630 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14455                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14456                                  
 14457                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14458                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14459                                  
 14460                                  gotdmaerr:				
 14461 00001632 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14462 00001635 FB                      		sti
 14463 00001636 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14464 00001639 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14465                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14466                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14467 0000163B 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14468 0000163E 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14469 00001640 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14470 00001643 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14471 00001645 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14472                                  
 14473                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14474                                  
 14475                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14476                                  
 14477 00001647 52                      		push	dx
 14478 00001648 51                      		push	cx
 14479 00001649 53                      		push	bx
 14480 0000164A 50                      		push	ax
 14481 0000164B 55                      		push	bp
 14482 0000164C 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14483 0000164E 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14484 00001650 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14485 00001652 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14486 00001654 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14487 00001656 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14488 00001658 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14489 0000165A 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14490                                  
 14491                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14492                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14493                                  
 14494 0000165E 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14495 00001660 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14496                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14497                                  
 14498                                  no_skip_first:				
 14499 00001663 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14500 00001665 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14501 00001667 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14502                                  
 14503                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14504                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14505                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14506                                  ;
 14507                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14508                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14509                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14510                                  ; in error.
 14511                                  
 14512 00001669 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14513 0000166B 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14514                                  
 14515                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14516                                  
 14517 0000166D 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14518                                  					; set up head number
 14519 00001670 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14520 00001673 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14521                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14522                                  
 14523                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 14524 00001676 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14525 00001678 F9                      		stc
 14526 00001679 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14527                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14528                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14529                                  
 14530                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14531                                  
 14532                                  intverify:				
 14533 0000167C 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14534 0000167D 53                      		push	bx
 14535 0000167E 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14536 0000167F 07                      		pop	es
 14537                                  dosimple:				
 14538 00001680 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14539                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14540                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14541                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14542 00001683 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14543                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14544 00001688 5B                      		pop	bx
 14545 00001689 07                      		pop	es
 14546 0000168A E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14547                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14548                                  
 14549                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14550                                  
 14551                                  intformat:				
 14552 0000168D 06                      		push	es
 14553 0000168E 53                      		push	bx
 14554 0000168F 56                      		push	si
 14555 00001690 57                      		push	di
 14556 00001691 1E                      		push	ds
 14557                                  
 14558                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14559                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14560                                  
 14561 00001692 06                      		push	es
 14562 00001693 1E                      		push	ds
 14563 00001694 07                      		pop	es
 14564 00001695 1F                      		pop	ds
 14565 00001696 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14566 00001698 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14567 0000169B E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14568 0000169E 1F                      		pop	ds
 14569 0000169F 5F                      		pop	di
 14570 000016A0 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14571 000016A1 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14572                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14573                                  
 14574                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14575                                  ; the first block.
 14576                                  ;
 14577                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14578                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14579                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14580                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14581                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14582                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14583                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14584                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14585                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14586                                  
 14587                                  doblock:
 14588                                  
 14589                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14590                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14591                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14592                                  				
 14593 000016A3 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14594                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14595 000016A6 51                      		push	cx
 14596 000016A7 06                      		push	es
 14597 000016A8 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14598                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14599 000016A9 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14600 000016AC 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14601                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14602 000016B0 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14603                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14604 000016B5 5F                      		pop	di
 14605 000016B6 07                      		pop	es
 14606 000016B7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14607 000016B9 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14608 000016BB B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14609 000016BD 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14610                                  doblockflop:				
 14611 000016BF 59                      		pop	cx
 14612                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14613 000016C0 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14614 000016C2 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14615 000016C4 50                      		push	ax
 14616 000016C5 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14617 000016C7 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14618                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14619                                  
 14620                                  doblocklast:				
 14621 000016C9 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14622 000016CB 50                      		push	ax
 14623                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14624 000016CC E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14625 000016CF 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14626 000016D1 58                      		pop	ax
 14627 000016D2 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14628                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14629 000016D5 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14630 000016D7 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14631 000016D9 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14632 000016DB 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14633 000016DD 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14634                                  					; then we are done already.
 14635 000016DF 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14636                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14637 000016E1 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14638 000016E4 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14639                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14640                                  
 14641                                  bufferx:				
 14642 000016E6 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14643                                  					; set up head number
 14644                                  buffer:					
 14645 000016E9 53                      		push	bx
 14646 000016EA 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14647 000016ED 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14648 000016F0 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14649                                  					
 14650                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14651                                  
 14652 000016F2 06                      		push	es
 14653 000016F3 1E                      		push	ds
 14654 000016F4 56                      		push	si
 14655 000016F5 57                      		push	di
 14656 000016F6 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14657 000016F7 06                      		push	es
 14658 000016F8 1F                      		pop	ds
 14659 000016F9 07                      		pop	es
 14660 000016FA BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14661 000016FD 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14662 000016FE 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14663 00001700 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14664 00001703 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14665                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14666 00001704 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14667 00001705 5E                      		pop	si
 14668 00001706 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14669                                  
 14670                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14671                                  
 14672 00001707 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14673                                  					; get drive number
 14674 00001709 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14675 0000170C E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14676                                  					;
 14677                                  					; ah is	function
 14678                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14679                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14680                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14681                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14682                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14683 0000170F E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14684 00001712 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14685 00001713 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14686 00001715 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14687                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14688                                  
 14689                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14690                                  
 14691                                  doread:					
 14692 00001717 06                      		push	es
 14693 00001718 53                      		push	bx
 14694 00001719 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14695 0000171A 07                      		pop	es
 14696 0000171B BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14697 0000171E B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14698 00001720 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14699                                  					; get drive number
 14700 00001723 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14701                                  					; ah = function
 14702                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14703                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14704                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14705 00001726 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14706 00001729 5B                      		pop	bx
 14707 0000172A 07                      		pop	es
 14708 0000172B 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14709 0000172D 56                      		push	si
 14710 0000172E 57                      		push	di
 14711 0000172F 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14712 00001731 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14713 00001734 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14714 00001737 5F                      		pop	di
 14715 00001738 5E                      		pop	si
 14716                                  
 14717                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14718                                  
 14719                                  dotail:					
 14720 00001739 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14721 0000173A 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14722 0000173D 41                      		inc	cx
 14723 0000173E 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14724 00001741 F8                      		clc
 14725 00001742 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14726 00001744 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14727                                  
 14728                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14729                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14730                                  
 14731 00001746 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14732 00001749 E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14733 0000174C E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14734                                  
 14735                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14736                                  
 14737                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14738                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14739                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14740                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14741                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14742                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14743                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14744                                  
 14745                                  bad13:					
 14746 0000174F 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14747 00001751 5D                      		pop	bp
 14748 00001752 5B                      		pop	bx
 14749 00001753 5B                      		pop	bx
 14750 00001754 59                      		pop	cx
 14751 00001755 5A                      		pop	dx
 14752 00001756 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14753 00001758 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14754                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14755                                  
 14756                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14757 0000175B E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14758                                  
 14759                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14760                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14761                                  		;db 	0
 14762                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14763                                  
 14764                                  ;Bios_Code ends

 14781                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14782                                  
 14783                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14784                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14785                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14786                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14787                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14788                                  
 14789                                  install_bds:
 14790 0000176A 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14791 0000176B BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14792                                  
 14793                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14794                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14795                                  loop_next_bds:
 14796 0000176E C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14797                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14798 00001770 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14799 00001774 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14800                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14801 00001777 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14802 00001779 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14803 0000177B 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14804                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14805 0000177F 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14806 00001782 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14807                                  					; we don't own it
 14808 00001787 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14809                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14810 0000178A 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14811 0000178D 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14812                                  next_bds:
 14813                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14814 00001791 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14815 00001794 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14816                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14817                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14818 00001796 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14819 00001798 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14820                                  					; install bds
 14821 0000179B 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14822 0000179D 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14823                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14824                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14825 000017A0 1F                      		pop	ds
 14826

 14928                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
