 15820                                  section .SYSINIT vstart=0
 15821                                  
 15822                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15823                                  ; SYSINIT.BIN (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) - RETRO DOS v4.0 by ERDOGAN TAN - 21/10/2022
 15824                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15825                                  ; Last Update: 04/01/2023 (Modified IO.SYS)  ((Previous: 30/12/2022))
 15826                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15827                                  ; Beginning: 03/06/2018 (Retro DOS 3.0), 21/03/2019 (Retro DOS 4.0)
 15828                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15829                                  ; Assembler: NASM version 2.15
 15830                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15831                                  ;	   ((nasm sysinit6.s -l sysinit6.lst -o SYSINIT6.BIN -Z error.txt)) 	
 15832                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15833                                  ; Modified from 'sysinit2.s' (SYSINIT2.BIN) file of Retro DOS v3.0 (6/7/2018)
 15834                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15835                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT1.ASM' and 'SYSINIT2.ASM' files of MSDOS 6.0
 15836                                  ; source code by Microsoft, 1991 
 15837                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15838                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT.ASM' file of MSDOS 2.0 (IBM PCDOS v2.0) source code
 15839                                  ; by Microsoft, 12/10/1983
 15840                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15841                                  ; main file: 'retrodos4.s'
 15842                                  ; incbin 'SYSINIT3.BIN' ; (SYINITSEG)
 15843                                  
 15844                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 15845                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 - 2019
 15846                                  ; SYSINIT (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) draft: 'sysinit3.s' (01/07/2019)
 15847                                   
 15848                                  ; 21/10/2022
 15849                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15850                                  ; This source code (version) is based on SYSINIT source code of disassembled
 15851                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS file (SYSINIT.BIN) 
 15852                                  ; Dissassembler: Hex-Rays Interactive Disassembler (IDA)
 15853                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15854                                  ; Binary file splitter & joiner: FFSJ v3.3
 15855                                  
 15856                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15857                                  ; SYSINIT.TXT (27/01/1983)
 15858                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15859                                  ;    SYSINIT is  a module linked behind the OEM bios.  It takes
 15860                                  ;over  the  system  initialization  after  the  OEM  bios   has
 15861                                  ;performed any  initialization  it  needs  to  do.   Control is
 15862                                  ;transfered with a long jump to the external  variable  SYSINIT
 15863                                  ;
 15864                                  ;
 15865                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared external:
 15866                                  ;
 15867                                  ;   CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION    WORD
 15868                                  ;
 15869                                  ;This word  contains  the  segment  number of the DOS before it
 15870                                  ;is relocated.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15871                                  ;
 15872                                  ;   FINAL_DOS_LOCATION      WORD
 15873                                  ;
 15874                                  ;This word contains the segment number of the DOS after SYSINIT
 15875                                  ;moves it.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15876                                  ;
 15877                                  ;   DEVICE_LIST             DWORD
 15878                                  ;
 15879                                  ;This  double  word  pointer  points  to  the  linked  list  of
 15880                                  ;character and block device drivers.  The  OEM  must  set  this
 15881                                  ;value.
 15882                                  ;
 15883                                  ;   MEMORY_SIZE             WORD
 15884                                  ;
 15885                                  ;This word  contains  the  number  of  RAM  paragraphs.  If the
 15886                                  ;bios doesn't set  this  variable  SYSINIT  will  automatically
 15887                                  ;calculate it.   NOTE:  systems with PARITY checked memory must
 15888                                  ;size memory in the BIOS.  SYSINITs method is to  write  memory
 15889                                  ;and read it back until it gets a mismatch.
 15890                                  ;
 15891                                  ;   DEFAULT_DRIVE           BYTE
 15892                                  ;
 15893                                  ;This is  the initial default drive when the system first comes
 15894                                  ;up.  drive a=0, drive b=1,  etc.   If  the  bios  doesn't  set
 15895                                  ;it then drive a is assumed.
 15896                                  ;
 15897                                  ;   BUFFERS                 BYTE
 15898                                  ;
 15899                                  ;This is  the  default  number of buffers for the system.  This
 15900                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15901                                  ;It is DBed to 2 in SYSINIT it should be greater than 1.
 15902                                  ;
 15903                                  ;   FILES                   BYTE
 15904                                  ;
 15905                                  ;This is  the  default  number  of  files for the system.  This
 15906                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15907                                  ;It is  DBed  to  8 in SYSINIT, values less than 5 are ignored.
 15908                                  ;
 15909                                  ;   SYSINIT                 FAR
 15910                                  ;
 15911                                  ;The entry  point  of  the  SYSINIT  module.  OEM BIOS jumps to
 15912                                  ;this label at the end of its INIT code.
 15913                                  ;
 15914                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared public:
 15915                                  ;
 15916                                  ;   RE_INIT                 FAR
 15917                                  ;
 15918                                  ;This is an entry point which allows the BIOS to do some INIT
 15919                                  ;work  after  the  DOS is initialized.  ALL REGISTERS MUST BE
 15920                                  ;PRESERVED.  On entry DS points to the first available memory
 15921                                  ;(after  the DOS).  DS:0 points to a 100H byte program header
 15922                                  ;prefix which represents  the  "program"  currently  running.
 15923                                  ;This  program  should  be  thought  of  as  the OEM BIOS and
 15924                                  ;SYSINIT taken together.  This is not  a  normal  program  in
 15925                                  ;that  no  memory  is  allocated to it, it is running in free
 15926                                  ;memory.
 15927                                  ;NOTES:
 15928                                  ;     At the time this routine is called SYSINIT occupies the
 15929                                  ;highest 10K of memory ("highest" is determined by the  value
 15930                                  ;of the MEMORY_SIZE variable), DO NOT DO WRITES THERE.
 15931                                  ;     Since this is called AFTER DOS is initialized, you can
 15932                                  ;make system calls.  This also implies that the code for this
 15933                                  ;routine    CANNOT   be   thrown   away   by   use   of   the
 15934                                  ;FINAL_DOS_LOCATION since the DOS has already been moved.
 15935                                  ;     If you don't want  anything done just set this to point
 15936                                  ;at a FAR RET instruction.
 15937                                  
 15938                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15939                                  ; TITLE   BIOS SYSTEM INITIALIZATION
 15940                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15941                                  
 15942                                  ;include version.inc
 15943                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15944                                  
 15945                                  ;FALSE   EQU     0
 15946                                  ;TRUE    EQU     0FFFFh
 15947                                  
 15948                                  ;IBMVER	    EQU     TRUE
 15949                                  ;IBMCOPYRIGHT EQU   FALSE
 15950                                  ;STACKSW    EQU	    TRUE		;Include Switchable Hardware Stacks
 15951                                  ;IBMJAPVER  EQU     FALSE		; If TRUE set KANJI true also
 15952                                  ;MSVER      EQU     FALSE
 15953                                  ;ALTVECT    EQU     FALSE		; Switch to build ALTVECT version
 15954                                  ;KANJI      EQU     FALSE
 15955                                  
 15956                                  ;(MSDOS 6.0, versiona.inc, 1991)
 15957                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15958                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION  EQU	6
 15959                                  ;;MINOR_VERSION	EQU	0	;6.00
 15960                                  ;MINOR_VERSION  EQU	21	;6.21  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15961                                  
 15962                                  ; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
 15963                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15964                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	5
 15965                                  ;MINOR_VERSION   EQU	0
 15966                                  
 15967                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21)
 15968                                  MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	6
 15969                                  MINOR_VERSION   EQU	22
 15970                                  
 15971                                  expected_version equ	(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION
 15972                                  
 15973                                  ;DOSREVNM equ	00000000b       ; m037 - bits 0-2 = revision number of DOS
 15974                                  				; currently 0.
 15975                                  DOSREVNM equ	00000111b	; [[[ 7 for Retro DOS v4.0 ]]] (21/03/2019)	
 15976                                  DOSINROM equ	00001000B       ; bit 3 of ver flags returned in BH
 15977                                  DOSINHMA equ	00010000B       ; bit 4 of ver flags 
 15978                                  
 15979                                  ;      if1
 15980                                  ;      %OUT  ... for DOS Version 5.00 ...
 15981                                  ;      endif
 15982                                  
 15983                                         ;******************************
 15984                                         ;Each assembler program should:
 15985                                         ;  mov ah,030h                   ;DOS Get Version function
 15986                                         ;  int 021h                      ;Version ret. in AX,minor version first
 15987                                         ;  cmp ax,expected_version       ;ALL utilities should check for an
 15988                                         ;  jne error_handler             ; EXACT version match.
 15989                                         ;******************************
 15990                                  
 15991                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15992                                  ; device definitions
 15993                                  
 15994                                  ;Attribute bit masks
 15995                                  DEVTYP  EQU     8000h           ;Bit 15 - 1  if Char, 0 if block
 15996                                  DEVIOCTL EQU    4000h           ;Bit 14 - CONTROL mode bit
 15997                                  ISFATBYDEV EQU  2000h           ;Bit 13 - Device uses FAT ID bytes, comp media.
 15998                                  ISCIN   EQU     0001h           ;Bit 0 - This device is the console input.
 15999                                  ISCOUT  EQU     0002h           ;Bit 1 - This device is the console output.
 16000                                  ISNULL  EQU     0004h           ;Bit 2 - This device is the null device.
 16001                                  ISCLOCK EQU     0008h           ;Bit 3 - This device is the clock device.
 16002                                  ISIBM   EQU     0010h           ;Bit 4 - This device is special
 16003                                  
 16004                                  ; The device table list has the form:
 16005                                  struc	SYSDEV
 16006 00000000 ????????                .NEXT:		resd 1		;Pointer to next device header
 16007 00000004 ????                    .ATT:		resw 1		;Attributes of the device
 16008 00000006 ????                    .STRAT:		resw 1		;Strategy entry point
 16009 00000008 ????                    .INT:		resw 1		;Interrupt entry point
 16010 0000000A ????????????????        .NAME:		resb 8		;Name of device (only first byte used for block)
 16011                                  .size:
 16012                                  endstruc
 16013                                  
 16014                                  ;Static Reguest Header
 16015                                  struc	SRHEAD
 16016 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 16017 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 16018 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 16019 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 16020 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 16021                                  .size:
 16022                                  endstruc
 16023                                  
 16024                                  ;Status word masks
 16025                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 16026                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 16027                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 16028                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 16029                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 16030                                  
 16031                                  ;Function codes
 16032                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 16033                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 16034                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 16035                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 16036                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 16037                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 16038                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 16039                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 16040                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 16041                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 16042                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 16043                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 16044                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 16045                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 16046                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 16047                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 16048                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 16049                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 16050                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 16051                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
 16052                                  
 16053                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16054                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 16055 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 16056 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 16057 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 16058 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 16059 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 16060 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 16061                                                          ; word
 16062 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 16063 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 16064 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 16065 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 16066                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 16067                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 16068                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16069                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16070                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16071                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16072                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 16073                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16074 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 16075 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 16076 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 16077 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 16078 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 16079 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 16080                                  .size:
 16081                                  endstruc
 16082                                  
 16083                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16084                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 16085                                  
 16086                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 16087                                  
 16088                                  struc buffinfo
 16089 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 16090 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 16091 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 16092                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 16093                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 16094 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 16095                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 16096                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 16097                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 16098                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 16099                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 16100                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 16101                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 16102                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 16103 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 16104                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 16105 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 16106 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 16107 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 16108 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 16109 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 16110                                  .size:
 16111                                  endstruc
 16112                                  
 16113                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 16114                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 16115                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 16116                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 16117                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 16118                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 16119                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 16120                                  
 16121                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 16122                                  
 16123                                  
 16124                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 16125                                  
 16126                                  ;Flag byte masks
 16127                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 16128                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 16129                                  ;***
 16130                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 16131                                  ;***
 16132                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 16133                                  
 16134                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 16135                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 16136                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 16137                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 16138                                  
 16139                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz

 16142                                  
 16143                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16144                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 16145                                  
 16146                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 16147                                  
 16148                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 16149                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 16150                                  ;
 16151                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 16152                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 16153                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 16154                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 16155                                  ;
 16156                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 16157                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 16158                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 16159                                  
 16160                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 16161                                  
 16162                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16163                                  
 16164                                  struc	DPB
 16165 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 16166 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 16167 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 16168 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 16169 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 16170 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 16171 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 16172 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 16173 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 16174 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 16175                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16176 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 16177 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 16178 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 16179 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 16180 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 16181                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 16182 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 16183 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 16184 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 16185                                  .size:
 16186                                  endstruc
 16187                                  
 16188                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 16189                                  
 16190                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)

 16247                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 16248                                  
 16249                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 16250                                  ;
 16251                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 16252                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 16253                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 16254                                  ;
 16255                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 16256                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 16257                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 16258                                  ;
 16259                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 16260                                  
 16261                                  struc A_BPB
 16262 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 16263 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 16264 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 16265 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 16266 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 16267 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 16268 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 16269 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 16270 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 16271 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 16272 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 16273 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 16274 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 16275 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 16276 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 16277                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 16278                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 16279                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 16280                                  .size:
 16281                                  endstruc
 16282                                  
 16283                                  struc A_DEVICEPARAMETERS
 16284 00000000 ??                      .DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS:	resb	1
 16285 00000001 ??                      .DP_DEVICETYPE:		resb	1
 16286 00000002 ????                    .DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES:	resw	1
 16287 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1
 16288 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1

 16291 00000028 <res FCh>               .DP_SECTORTABLE:	resb	MAX_SECTORS_IN_TRACK * A_SECTORTABLE.size

 16540                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16541                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 16542                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16543                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 16544                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 16545                                  									  
 16546                                  ;*******************************					  
 16547                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 16548                                  ;*******************************					  
 16549                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 16550                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 16551                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 16552                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16553                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 16554                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 16555                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16556                                  ;For all others:							  
 16557                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 16558                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 16559                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 16560                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 16561                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 16562                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 16563                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 16564                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 16565                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16566                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 16567                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 16568                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 16569                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 16570                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 16571                                  ;									  
 16572                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 16573                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 16574                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16575                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 16576                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 16577                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 16578                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 16579                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 16580                                  ;									  
 16581                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 16582                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 16583                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 16584                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 16585                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 16586                                  ;									  
 16587                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 16588                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 16589                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 16590                                  ;									  
 16591                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 16592                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 16593                                  ;									  
 16594                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 16595                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 16596                                  ;									  
 16597                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 16598                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 16599                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 16600                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 16601                                  ;						called. 		  
 16602                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 16603                                  ;									  
 16604                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16605                                  ;									  
 16606                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16607                                  ;									  
 16608                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16609                                  ;									  
 16610                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16611                                  ;									  
 16612                                  
 16613                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 16614                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 16615 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 16616 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 16617                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 16618 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16619 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16620 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 16621 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 16622                                  endstruc					  
 16623

 16625                                  DMAchannel3		equ 10000000b					  
 16626                                  ScndIntController	equ 01000000b					  
 16627                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b					  
 16628                                  KeyEscapeSeq		equ 00010000b					  
 16629                                  					;;End of Modification

 16731                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16732                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16733                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16734                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16735                                  
 16736                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 16737                                  ;
 16738                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 16739                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 16740                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 16741                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 16742                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 16743                                  ;
 16744                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 16745                                  ;
 16746                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 16747                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 16748                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 16749                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 16750                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 16751                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 16752                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 16753                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 16754                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 16755                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 16756                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 16757                                  
 16758                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 16759                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 16760                                  
 16761                                  struc 		curdir_list
 16762                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16763 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 16764 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 16765 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 16766 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 16767 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 16768 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 16769                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 16770 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 16771 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 16772 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 16773                                  .size:
 16774                                  endstruc
 16775                                  
 16776                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 16777                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 16778                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 16779                                  						; argument
 16780                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]

 16791                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16792                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16793                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16794                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16795                                  
 16796                                  ; system file table
 16797                                  
 16798                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 16799                                  ;
 16800                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 16801                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 16802                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 16803                                  
 16804                                  struc	SF
 16805 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 16806 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 16807 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 16808                                  .size:
 16809                                  endstruc
 16810                                  
 16811                                  ;**	System file table entry
 16812                                  ;
 16813                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 16814                                  
 16815                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 16816 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 16817                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 16818 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 16819 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 16820 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 16821                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 16822                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 16823                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 16824                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 16825                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 16826                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 16827                                  					;   (WRITE)
 16828                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 16829                                  					;
 16830                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 16831                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 16832                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 16833                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 16834                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 16835                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 16836                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16837                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16838                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16839                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16840                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 16841                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16842 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 16843                                  					; to device header if local device,
 16844                                  					; points to net device header if
 16845                                  					; remote
 16846 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 16847                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 16848 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 16849 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 16850 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 16851 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 16852                                  ;
 16853                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 16854                                  ; ID
 16855                                  ;
 16856 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 16857 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 16858 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above

 17146                                  	;IF	STACKSW 
 17147                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions
 17148                                  	; include STKMES.INC	;Fatal stack error message

 17152                                  
 17153                                  ; 05/07/2018
 17154                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17155                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17156                                  
 17157                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17158                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 17159                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17160                                  
 17161                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 17162                                  ;
 17163                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 17164                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 17165                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 17166                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 17167                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 17168                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 17169                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 17170                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 17171                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 17172                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 17173                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 17174                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 17175                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 17176                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 17177                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 17178                                  ;
 17179                                  
 17180                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 17181                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 17182                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 17183                                  ;
 17184                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 17185                                  ;
 17186                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 17187                                  ;
 17188                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 17189                                  ;
 17190                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 17191                                  ;
 17192                                  
 17193                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 17194                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 17195                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 17196                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 17197                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 17198                                  ;      deeply nested one
 17199                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 17200                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 17201                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 17202                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 17203                                  
 17204                                  		;EVEN
 17205                                  ;align 2
 17206                                  		; 21/10/2022
 17207                                  
 17208 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 17209 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 17210 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 17211 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 17212 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 17213 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 17214                                  
 17215 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 17216 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 17217 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 17218                                  
 17219                                  ;***********************************************************************
 17220                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 17221                                  
 17222                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17223                                  
 17224 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 17225                                  
 17226                                  int02:
 17227                                  
 17228                                  ; *********************************************************************
 17229                                  ;
 17230                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 17231                                  ;
 17232                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 17233                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 17234                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 17235                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 17236                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 17237                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 17238                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 17239                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 17240                                  ;
 17241                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 17242                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 17243                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 17244                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 17245                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 17246                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 17247                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 17248                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 17249                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 17250                                  ;
 17251                                  ; *********************************************************************
 17252                                  
 17253 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 17254 00000017 06                      	push	es
 17255 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 17256 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 17257                                  	; 02/11/2022
 17258 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 17259 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 17260 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 17261                                  
 17262 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 17263                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 17264                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 17265                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 17266                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 17267 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 17268 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 17269                                  special02:
 17270 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 17271 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 17272                                  normal02:
 17273 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 17274 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 17275 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02

 17501                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17502                                  
 17503                                  ;********************************************************************
 17504                                  ;common routines
 17505                                  ;********************************************************************
 17506                                  
 17507                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 17508                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 17509                                  ; service routine
 17510                                  
 17511                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 17512                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17513                                  
 17514                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 17515                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 17516                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 17517                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 17518                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 17519                                  
 17520                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 17521                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:0147h)
 17522                                  
 17523                                  do_int_stacks:
 17524 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 17525 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 17526 00000149 06                      	push	es
 17527 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 17528 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 17529 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 17530                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17531                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 17532                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17533 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 17534 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 17535 0000015C 7551                    	jne	short notfree02
 17536                                  
 17537 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 17538                                  
 17539                                  found02:
 17540 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 17541 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 17542                                  
 17543 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 17544                                  
 17545 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 17546                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17547                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 17548                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17549                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 17550 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 17551 00000176 7544                    	jne	short foundbad02
 17552                                  
 17553                                  	; 02/07/2023 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT code)
 17554 00000178 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 17555 0000017A 8EC5                    	mov	es,bp
 17556 0000017C 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 17557 0000017E 8B6E06                  	mov	bp,[bp+6]
 17558 00000181 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 17559 00000183 8CC4                    	mov	sp,es
 17560 00000185 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 17561 00000187 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 17562                                  
 17563                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT code)
 17564                                  	;push    bp
 17565                                  	;mov     bp,sp
 17566                                  	;mov     ax,[bp+8]
 17567                                  	;pop     bp
 17568                                  	;push    es
 17569                                  	;pop     ss
 17570                                  	;mov     sp,bp
 17571                                  	;mov     bp,ax
 17572                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17573                                  	;;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 17574                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 17575                                  
 17576 0000018B 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 17577                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17578 0000018C 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 17579                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17580                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 17581                                  
 17582 00000190 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 17583                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17584 00000192 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 17585                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17586                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 17587 00000196 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 17588 0000019A 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 17589                                  
 17590                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17591                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 17592                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17593 0000019E 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 17594 000001A3 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 17595                                  
 17596 000001A8 07                      	pop	es
 17597 000001A9 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 17598 000001AA 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 17599 000001AB 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 17600 000001AE CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 17601                                  
 17602                                  notfree02:
 17603 000001AF 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 17604 000001B1 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 17605                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17606                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 17607                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17608 000001B3 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 17609                                  
 17610                                  findnext02:
 17611 000001B7 E81200                  	call	longpath
 17612 000001BA EBA8                    	jmp	short found02
 17613                                  
 17614                                  foundbad02:
 17615 000001BC 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 17616 000001C1 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 17617 000001C3 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 17618                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17619                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 17620                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17621 000001C5 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 17622 000001CA EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 17623                                  
 17624                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17625                                  
 17626                                  ; Common routines
 17627                                  
 17628                                  longpath:
 17629                                  	; 21/03/2019
 17630 000001CC 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 17631                                  lploopp:
 17632                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17633                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 17634                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17635 000001D1 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 17636 000001D6 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 17637                                  
 17638 000001D8 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 17639                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17640                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 17641                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17642 000001DA 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 17643 000001DE 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 17644 000001E0 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 17645                                  
 17646 000001E2 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 17647 000001E4 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 17648                                  
 17649                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17650                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 17651                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17652 000001E6 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 17653                                  inuse:
 17654 000001EA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 17655 000001EF 7406                    	je	short fatal
 17656 000001F1 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 17657 000001F4 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 17658                                  found:
 17659 000001F6 C3                      	retn
 17660                                  fatal:
 17661 000001F7 1E                      	push	ds
 17662 000001F8 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 17663 000001FB 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 17664 000001FD 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 17665 00000202 1F                      	pop	ds
 17666 00000203 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 17667                                  
 17668 00000205 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 17669 00000207 E672                    	out	72h,al
 17670                                  
 17671                                  skip_nmis:
 17672 00000209 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 17673 0000020A B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 17674 0000020C E621                    	out	021h,al
 17675 0000020E E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 17676                                  
 17677 00000210 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 17678 00000212 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 17679 00000214 BE[3B02]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 17680                                  ;SR;
 17681                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 17682                                  ;
 17683 00000217 50                      	push	ax
 17684 00000218 1E                      	push	ds
 17685                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 17686                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 17687                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17688 00000219 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 17689 0000021C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 17690                                  
 17691                                  	;test	byte [08D0h],1 	; (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:021Eh)
 17692 0000021E F606[6F08]01            	test	byte [IsWin386],1 ; (retrodos4.sys, offset: ****h)
 17693 00000223 1F                      	pop	ds
 17694 00000224 58                      	pop	ax
 17695 00000225 7405                    	jz	short fatal_loop	; win386 not present, continue
 17696                                  
 17697                                  	;;call	far ptr 0070h:08D1h ; (MSDOS 621, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0227h)
 17698                                  	;call	KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; set focus to this VM
 17699                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17700 00000227 9A[7008]7000            	call	DOSBIODATASEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; 0070h:08D1h
 17701                                  ;
 17702                                  ;SR; We do not bother about the returned status of this call. 
 17703                                  ;
 17704                                  fatal_loop:
 17705 0000022C AC                      	lodsb
 17706 0000022D 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'
 17707 0000022F 7408                    	je	short fatal_done
 17708                                  
 17709 00000231 B307                    	mov	bl,7
 17710 00000233 B40E                    	mov	ah,14

 17712 00000237 EBF3                    	jmp	short fatal_loop

 18966                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 18967                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 18968                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 18969                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 18970                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 18971                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 18972                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 18973                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 18974                                  ;
 18975                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 18976                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 18977                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 18978                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 18979                                  ; been patched.

 19294                                  
 19295                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"
 19296                                  ;   in memory, can be trashed (and in fact is -- see references to retry
 19297                                  ;   which follow....)
 19298                                  
 19299                                  retry:
 19300 00000779 BA[AB45]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 19301                                  
 19302                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 19303                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 19304                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 19305                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 19306                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 19307                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 19308                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 19309                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 19310                                  
 19311                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 19312

 19337                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 19338                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 19339                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 19340                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 19341                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 19342                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 19343                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 19344                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 19345                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 19346                                  ;
 19347                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 19348                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 19349                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 19350                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 19351                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 19352                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 19353                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP

 20179 000009FA 7250                    	jc	short FatalErr			; IF ERR WE ARE HOSED
