 20194 00000A0F C3                      	retn
 20195                                  
 20196                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 20197                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 20198                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 20199                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 20200                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 20201                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 20202                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 20203                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 20204                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 20205                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 20206                                  ;	  stub will go.
 20207                                  ;
 20208                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 20209                                  
 20210                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20211                                  update_arena:
 20212 00000A10 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 20213 00000A11 57                      	push	di
 20214 00000A12 51                      	push	cx
 20215 00000A13 52                      	push	dx
 20216                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20217                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 20218                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20219                                  	; ds = cs 
 20220 00000A14 C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 20221 00000A18 4F                      	dec	di
 20222 00000A19 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 20223                                  						;  before sysvar
 20224 00000A1A 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 20225                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 20226 00000A1C 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 20227 00000A21 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 20228 00000A23 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 20229                                  
 20230                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 20231 00000A25 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 20232 00000A2A 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 20233 00000A2C 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 20234 00000A2E 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 20235 00000A30 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20236                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 20237 00000A32 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 20238                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 20239 00000A36 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 20240 00000A3C 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 20241                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 20242 00000A3E 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 20243 00000A42 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 20244                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20245                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 20246 00000A44 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 20247 00000A47 5A                      	pop	dx
 20248 00000A48 59                      	pop	cx
 20249 00000A49 5F                      	pop	di
 20250 00000A4A 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 20251 00000A4B C3                      	retn
 20252                                  ;
 20253                                  ; M012 : END
 20254                                  ;
 20255                                  FatalErr:
 20256 00000A4C 0E                      	push	cs
 20257 00000A4D 1F                      	pop	ds
 20258 00000A4E BA[1909]                	mov	dx,FEmsg
 20259 00000A51 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 20260 00000A53 CD21                    	int	21h 		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 20261                                  				; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 20262                                  	; 30/12/2022 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 20263 00000A55 E92C07                  	jmp	stall
 20264                                  	; 23/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20265                                  	;cli
 20266                                  	;hlt
 20267                                  
 20268                                  ;endif ;ROMDOS

 20274                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 20275                                  ;
 20276                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 20277                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 20278                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 20279                                  ;
 20280                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 20281                                  ;
 20282                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20283                                  
 20284                                  AllocHMA:
 20285                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 20286                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 20287                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 20288                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 20289                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 20290                                  
 20291                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 20292                                  ;
 20293                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 20294                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 20295                                  ;	push	ax
 20296                                  ;	popf
 20297                                  ;	pushf
 20298                                  ;	pop	ax
 20299                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 20300                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 20301                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 20302                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 20303                                  
 20304                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20305                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 20306                                  
 20307 00000A58 1E                      	push	ds
 20308                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 20309                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 20310                                  	; 21/10/2022
 20311 00000A59 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 20312 00000A5C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20313                                  
 20314 00000A5E E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 20315 00000A61 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 20316                                  
 20317 00000A63 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 20318 00000A66 CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 20319                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 20320                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 20321                                  
 20322 00000A68 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 20323                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 20324 00000A6C 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 20325                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 20326                                  
 20327 00000A70 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 20328 00000A72 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 20329                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 20330 00000A75 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 20331 00000A79 48                      	dec	ax
 20332 00000A7A 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 20333                                  
 20334                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 20335                                  
 20336 00000A7C B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 20337 00000A7E CD15                    	int	15h
 20338                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 20339                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 20340                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 20341 00000A80 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 20342                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 20343                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20344 00000A83 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 20345                                  allocHMA_1:
 20346 00000A85 B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 20347                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 20348 00000A87 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 20349 00000A8B 48                      	dec	ax
 20350 00000A8C 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 20351                                  
 20352 00000A8E E88501                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 20353 00000A91 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 20354                                  
 20355 00000A93 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20356 00000A96 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20357 00000A98 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 20358 00000A9F 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 20359                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 20360                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20361 00000AA6 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 20362                                  
 20363                                  ; 11/12/2022
 20364                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 20365                                  ;	; cf=0
 20366                                  ;	;clc
 20367                                  ;	pop	ds
 20368                                  ;	retn
 20369                                  
 20370                                  grabhma_error:
 20371 00000AA8 F9                      	stc
 20372                                  	; 11/12/022
 20373                                  grabhma_err:	; cf=1
 20374                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 20375 00000AA9 1F                      	pop	ds
 20376 00000AAA C3                      	retn

 20381                                  ;

 20383                                  ;

 20392                                  				; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed

 20442                                  
 20443                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20444                                  ;
 20445                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20446                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20447                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20448                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20449                                  ;
 20450                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20451                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20452                                  ;
 20453                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20454                                  
 20455                                  StartVDHead:
 20456                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20457                                  
 20458 00000AD0 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20459 00000AD4 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20460 00000AD6 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20461 00000AD8 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20462 00000ADA 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20463                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20464 00000ADB 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20465                                  VDiskSig1:
 20466 00000AE2 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20467                                  
 20468                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20469                                  
 20470 00000AE7 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20471                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20472 00000AED 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20473 00000AFC 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20474 00000AFE 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20475                                  VDInt19:
 20476 00000AFF EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20477                                  OldVDInt19:
 20478 00000B00 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20479                                  
 20480                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20481                                  
 20482                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20483 00000B04 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20484                                  VDiskSig2:
 20485 00000B07 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20486                                  
 20487                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20488                                  
 20489 00000B0C 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20490 00000B0F 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20491 00000B11 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20492 00000B12 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20493 00000B14 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20494 00000B15 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20495 00000B17 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20496 00000B19 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20497 00000B1A 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20498 00000B1C 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20499 00000B1E 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20500 00000B20 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20501 00000B22 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 20502                                  
 20503                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 20504                                  
 20505                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20506                                  ;
 20507                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20508                                  ;
 20509                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20510                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20511                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20512                                  ;
 20513                                  ; Inputs : None
 20514                                  ;
 20515                                  ; Outputs : None
 20516                                  ;
 20517                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20518                                  ;
 20519                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20520                                  
 20521                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20522                                  
 20523                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20524 00000B24 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20525 00000B26 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20526                                  
 20527                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20528                                  
 20529                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20530 00000B28 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20531                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20532 00000B2B 2EA3[000B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20533 00000B2F A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20534                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20535 00000B32 2EA3[020B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20536                                  
 20537                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20538                                  
 20539 00000B36 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20540                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20541                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20542 00000B38 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20543 00000B3B CD21                    	int	21h
 20544                                  
 20545                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20546                                  
 20547 00000B3D 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20548 00000B3E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20549                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20550 00000B40 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20551                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20552 00000B47 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20553 00000B4E 40                      	inc	ax
 20554 00000B4F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20555                                  
 20556                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20557                                  
 20558 00000B51 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20559                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20560 00000B52 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20561 00000B58 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20562                                  
 20563                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20564                                  
 20565                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 20566 00000B5B B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 20567 00000B5E BE[D00A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 20568 00000B61 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 20569 00000B63 0E                      	push	cs
 20570 00000B64 1F                      	pop	ds
 20571 00000B65 FC                      	cld
 20572 00000B66 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 20573 00000B68 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 20574                                  
 20575                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 20576                                  
 20577                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20578 00000B69 57                      	push	di
 20579 00000B6A 06                      	push	es
 20580                                  
 20581                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20582                                  	;mov	es,ax
 20583                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20584 00000B6B 49                      	dec	cx
 20585                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 20586 00000B6C 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 20587                                  
 20588 00000B6E BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 20589                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 20590 00000B71 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 20591 00000B74 BE[040B]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 20592 00000B77 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 20593                                  
 20594 00000B79 5F                      	pop	di
 20595 00000B7A 07                      	pop	es
 20596                                  
 20597 00000B7B C3                      	retn

 20599                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20600                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 20601                                  ;
 20602                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 20603                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 20604                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session

 20640 00000BAC 00<rep 20h>             ClrdVDISKHead:	times 32 db 0		; db 32 dup (0)
 20641                                  
 20642                                  
 20643                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 20644                                  
 20645                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20646                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 20647                                  
 20648                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20649                                  
 20650                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20651                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20652                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 20653                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 20654                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 20655                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 20656                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 20657                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 20658                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 20659                                  ;								      ;I070
 20660                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 20661                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 20662                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20663                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 20664                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 20665                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 20666                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 20667                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 20668                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 20669                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 20670                                  ;								      ;I070
 20671                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 20672                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20673                                  
 20674                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20675                                  	; ds = cs
 20676                                  
 20677                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 20678                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 20679                                  
 20680 00000BCC 06                      	push	es
 20681 00000BCD 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 20682 00000BCF 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 20683 00000BD1 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 20684 00000BD3 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20685 00000BD5 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20686 00000BD7 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20687 00000BD9 05[AC0B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 20688 00000BDC 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 20689                                  
 20690                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 20691                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20692                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 20693                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20694                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 20695                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20696                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20697 00000BDF A3[8E0B]                	mov	[src_desc+2],ax
 20698                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20699 00000BE2 8816[900B]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 20700                                  
 20701 00000BE6 B91000                  	mov	cx,16	; 16 words
 20702 00000BE9 0E                      	push	cs
 20703 00000BEA 07                      	pop	es
 20704 00000BEB BE[7C0B]                	mov	si,bmove
 20705 00000BEE B487                    	mov	ah,87h
 20706 00000BF0 CD15                    	int	15h	; EXTENDED MEMORY - BLOCK MOVE (AT,XT286,PS)
 20707                                  			; CX = number of words to move 
 20708                                  			; ES:SI -> global descriptor table
 20709                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AH = status
 20710 00000BF2 07                      	pop	es
 20711 00000BF3 C3                      	retn

 20715                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 20716                                  ;
 20717                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 20718                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 20719                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20720                                  ;		the offset.
 20721                                  ;
 20722                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 20723                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 20724                                  ;
 20725                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20726                                  
 20727                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:
 20728                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20729 00000BF4 1E                      	push	ds
 20730 00000BF5 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 20731 00000BF8 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20732                                  	;
 20733 00000BFA 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 20734 00000BFC B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh	   ; HMA segment
 20735                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20736 00000BFF A2[0D00]                	mov	[inHMA],al ; 0FFh
 20737                                  	;
 20738 00000C02 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 20739 00000C04 83C70F                  	add	di,15		   ; para round
 20740 00000C07 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 20741 00000C0A B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20742 00000C0C D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20743 00000C0E 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 20744                                  	;
 20745                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20746                                  	;push	ds
 20747                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 20748                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 20749                                  	; 21/10/2022
 20750                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20751                                  	;mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 20752                                  	;mov	ds,ax
 20753 00000C10 893E[9608]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20754                                  	;mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 20755 00000C14 1F                      	pop	ds
 20756 00000C15 C3                      	retn

 20758                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20759                                  ;
 20760                                  ; procedure : IsVDiskInstalled
 20761                                  ;
 20762                                  ;		Checks for the presence of VDISK header at 1MB boundary
 20763                                  ;		& INT 19 vector
 20764                                  ;
 20765                                  ; Inputs  : A20 flag should be ON
 20766                                  ; Outputs : Zero set if VDISK header found else Zero cleared
 20767                                  ;
 20768                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20769

 20797                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20798                                  ;
 20799                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20800                                  ;
 20801                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20802                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20803                                  ;
 20804                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20805                                  
 20806                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20807                                  CPMHack:
 20808 00000C3D 1E                      	push	ds
 20809 00000C3E B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20810 00000C41 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 20811                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20812                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20813 00000C43 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20814 00000C44 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20815 00000C46 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20816 00000C49 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20817                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20818 00000C4C B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20819 00000C4E FC                      	cld
 20820 00000C4F F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20821 00000C51 1F                      	pop	ds
 20822 00000C52 C3                      	retn

 21723                                  
 21724                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21725                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21726                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21727                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21728                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21729                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21730                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21731                                  ;
 21732                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21733                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21734                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21735                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21736                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21737                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21738                                  ;
 21739                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21740                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21741                                  ;
 21742                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21743                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21744                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21745                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21746                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21747                                  ;
 21748                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21749                                  ;
 21750                                  ;			  none.
 21751                                  
 21752                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21753                                  ;
 21754                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21755                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21756                                  
 21757                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21758                                  
 21759 00000FE5 50                      	push	ax
 21760 00000FE6 53                      	push	bx
 21761 00000FE7 52                      	push	dx

 21764 00000FE9 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh 		;reset h/w by writing to port
 21765 00000FEB BAF202                  	mov	dx,2F2h 		;get starting address
 21766 00000FEE EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f2h,0ffh
 21767 00000FEF 42                      	inc	dx

 21769 00000FF1 42                      	inc	dx

 21771 00000FF3 42                      	inc	dx
 21772 00000FF4 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f5h,0ffh
 21773 00000FF5 42                      	inc	dx
 21774 00000FF6 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f6h,0ffh
 21775 00000FF7 42                      	inc	dx

 21960                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21961                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21962                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 21963                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21964                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21965                                  ;
 21966                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21967                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21968                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21969                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21970                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21971                                  ; program).
 21972                                  
 21973                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 21974                                  
 21975                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 21976                                  
 21977 000010CD 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21978                                  
 21979                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 21980                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 21981                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 21982                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21983                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21984                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21985                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21986                                  ; carridge return.
 21987                                  
 21988                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 21989                                  ;character after =.
 21990                                  
 21991 000010CE 06                      	push	es
 21992 000010CF 1E                      	push	ds
 21993 000010D0 07                      	pop	es
 21994 000010D1 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 21995 000010D2 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 21996                                  
 21997 000010D4 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21998 000010D6 FC                      	cld
 21999 000010D7 2EC606[F102]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 22000 000010DD BF[F202]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 22001                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 22002 000010E0 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 22003                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22004 000010E1 08C0                    	or	al,al
 22005                                  	;cmp	al,0
 22006 000010E3 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 22007 000010E5 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 22008                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 22009 000010E7 AC                      	lodsb
 22010 000010E8 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 22011 000010EB 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 22012 000010ED 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 22013 000010EF FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 22014 000010F1 47                      	inc	di
 22015 000010F2 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 22016                                  done_installparm:
 22017 000010F4 2E880E[F002]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 22018                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22019 000010F9 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 22020                                  	;cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 22021 000010FB 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 22022 000010FD 2EC606[F102]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 22023                                  					; starts with cr.
 22024                                  install_seg_set:
 22025                                  	; 05/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 22026 00001103 31DB                    	xor	bx, bx
 22027                                  	;mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 22028 00001105 2E891F                  	mov	[cs:bx], bx ; 05/09/2023
 22029 00001108 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.

 22080 00001137 06                      	push	es			; save es,ds for load/exec
 22081 00001138 1E                      	push	ds			; these registers will be restored in sysinit_base.
 22082 00001139 2EFF2E[D202]            	jmp	far [cs:sysinit_base_ptr] ; jmp to sysinit_base to execute
 22083                                  					; load/exec function and check sum.
 22084                                  
 22085                                  ;----------------------------------------
 22086                                  
 22087                                  ;j.k. this is the returning address from sysinit_base.
 22088                                  
 22089                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 22090                                  
 22091                                  sysinitptr:				; returning far address from sysinit_base
 22092 0000113E 5E                      	pop	si			; restore si for config.sys file.
 22093 0000113F 06                      	push	es
 22094 00001140 1E                      	push	ds
 22095 00001141 07                      	pop	es
 22096 00001142 1F                      	pop	ds			; now ds - sysinitseg, es - confbot
 22097 00001143 7305                            jnc     short install_exit_ret
 22098                                  
 22099 00001145 56                      	push	si			; error in loading the file for install=.
 22100 00001146 E86033                  	call	badload 		; es:si-> path,filename,0.
 22101 00001149 5E                      	pop	si
 22102                                  
 22103                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22104                                  	;jmp	short sysinitptr_retn ; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1140h)
 22105                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22106                                  	; ds = cs
 22107                                  
 22108                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 22109                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1283h)
 22110                                  
 22111                                  install_exit_ret:
 22112 0000114A C3                      	retn
 22113                                  
 22114                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 22115                                  %if 0
 22116                                  install_exit_ret:
 22117                                  	;retn		; retn (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1283h) ; 18/12/2022
 22118                                  
 22119                                  	; 24/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 22120                                  ;SYSINIT:1142h:

 22132                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22133                                  
 22134                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22135                                  ;
 22136                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22137                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22138                                  ;
 22139                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22140                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22141                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22142                                  
 22143                                  ParaRound:
 22144 0000114B 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22145 0000114E D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22146 00001150 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22147 00001152 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22148 00001154 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22149 00001156 C3                      	retn

 22151                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22152                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22153                                  ;
 22154                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22155                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22156                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22157                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22158                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22159                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22160                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22161                                  ;
 22162                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22163                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22164                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22165                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 22166                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 22167                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 22168                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 22169                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 22170                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 22171                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 22172                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 22173                                  ;
 22174                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 22175                                  
 22176                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22177                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22178                                  sysinit_base:				
 22179 00001157 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22180 0000115C 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22181 00001161 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22182 00001163 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22183 00001168 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22184 0000116D 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22185 0000116E 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22186 0000116F 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22187                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22188                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 22189 00001171 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 22190 00001174 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 22191 00001179 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 22192                                  
 22193                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 22194                                  
 22195 0000117B B409                    	mov	ah,9
 22196 0000117D 0E                      	push	cs
 22197 0000117E 1F                      	pop	ds
 22198                                  	; 30/12/2022
 22199                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 22200                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 22201 0000117F BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22202                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 22203 00001182 CD21                    	int	21h
 22204                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 22205                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 22206                                  
 22207                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 22208                                  stall:
 22209                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22210                                  _stall: 
 22211                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22212 00001184 F4                      	hlt 
 22213                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22214                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 22215 00001185 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 22216                                  
 22217                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22218 00001187 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22219                                  
 22220                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22221                                  
 22222                                  sum_up:
 22223                                  
 22224                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22225                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22226                                  ;
 22227                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22228                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22229                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22230                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22231                                  ;
 22232                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22233                                  
 22234 0000118C 1E                      	push	ds
 22235                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 22236                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 22237 0000118D 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22238                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22239                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22240 00001191 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22241 00001193 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22242 00001195 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22243 00001197 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22244                                  					; whole test better fail.
 22245 0000119C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22246 0000119E 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22247                                  sum1:
 22248 000011A0 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22249 000011A2 46                      	inc	si
 22250 000011A3 46                      	inc	si
 22251 000011A4 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22252                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22253                                  sum_sys_code:
 22254                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22255 000011A6 BEA611                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22256                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22257                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22258                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22259                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22260                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22261                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22262                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 22263 000011A9 B9[704D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22264 000011AC 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22265 000011AE D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22266                                  sum2:
 22267 000011B0 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22268 000011B3 46                      	inc	si
 22269 000011B4 46                      	inc	si
 22270 000011B5 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22271 000011B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 22272 000011B8 C3                      	retn
 22273                                  
 22274                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22275                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22276                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 22277                                  
 22278                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 22279                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h) 	
 22280 000011B9 0000                    	dw	0
 22281                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 22282                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:			    ; = 64 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1292h)
 22283 000011BB 0000                    	dw	0	
 22284

 22291 000011BF 4D656D6F727920616C-     	db 	'Memory allocation error $'

 22298                                  ; Set_Buffer
 22299                                  ;
 22300                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 22301                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 22302                                  ;
 22303                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 22304                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 22305                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 22306                                  ;
 22307                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 22308                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 22309                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 22314                                  set_buffer:
 22315 000011D8 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 22316 000011DA E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 22317 000011DD 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 22318                                  	;mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA

 22320 000011DF FEC2                    	inc	dl ; mov dl,1

 22326 000011E3 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es

 22328 000011E6 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 22329                                  
 22330 000011EB 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 22331 000011ED 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 22332 000011F2 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 22333                                  
 22334                                  ;	for each buffer
 22335                                  
 22336                                  nxt_buff:
 22337 000011F3 E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 22338 000011F6 89C7                    	mov	di,ax

 22340                                  
 22341 000011FA 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 22342                                  
 22343 000011FF 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 22344                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 22345 00001200 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 22346 00001203 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 22347                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 22348                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22349 00001205 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 22350                                  
 22351 00001209 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMA ?
 22352 0000120B 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 22353                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 22354 0000120D C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 22355 00001211 2EA1[6403]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 22356                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 22357 00001215 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 22358                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 22359 0000121A 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 22360 0000121D 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 22361                                  	;; 05/09/2023
 22362                                  	;;sub	ax,24 ; bufinsiz		; (bufinsiz is 24 in PCDOS 7.1)
 22363 00001221 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 22364                                  set_buff_2:
 22365 00001224 2E0106[6203]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 22366                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 22367 00001229 2E800E[BD14]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 22368                                  	;call	round
 22369                                  	;retn
 22370                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22371 0000122F E93D30                  	jmp	round

 22373                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22374                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22375                                  ;
 22376                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22377                                  ;
 22378                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22379                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 22380                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22381                                  
 22382                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22383                                  GetBufferAddr:
 22384 00001232 53                      	push	bx
 22385 00001233 52                      	push	dx
 22386 00001234 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 22387 00001238 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 22388                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22389 0000123D 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 22390                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22391                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 22392                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22393 00001240 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 22394 00001242 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22395 00001244 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 22396                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 22397 00001247 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 22398 00001249 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22399 0000124C 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 22400                                  	
 22401                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 22402                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22403                                  	; zf=1
 22404 0000124E 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 22405                                  	; zf=1
 22406                                  	
 22407                                  	;zf=1
 22408                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 22409                                  	;zf=1
 22410 0000124F 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 22411                                  got_hma:
 22412 00001254 5A                      	pop	dx
 22413 00001255 5B                      	pop	bx
 22414 00001256 C3                      	retn

 22434                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 22435 00001269 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax

 22437 0000126C 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 22438                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22439 00001272 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 22440                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22441 00001278 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0

 22443                                  
 22444                                  ; ======================================================================
 22445                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22446                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22447                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22448                                  
 22449                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22450                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22451                                  ;
 22452                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22453                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22454                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22455                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22456                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22457                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22458                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22459                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22460                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22461                                  ;
 22462                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22463                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22464                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22465                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22466                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22467                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22468                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22469                                  ;	conditions:
 22470                                  ;
 22471                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22472                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22473                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22474                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22475                                  ;
 22476                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22477                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22478                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22479                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22480                                  ;
 22481                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22482                                  ;
 22483                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22484                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22485                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22486                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22487                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22488                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22489                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22490                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22491                                  ;
 22492                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22493                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22494                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22495                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22496                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 22497                                  ;
 22498                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22499                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22500                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22501                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22502                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22503                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22504                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22505                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22506                                  ;
 22507                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22508                                  
 22509                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22510                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22511                                  
 22512                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22513                                  stackinit:
 22514 0000127F 50                      	push	ax
 22515 00001280 1E                      	push	ds
 22516 00001281 06                      	push	es
 22517 00001282 53                      	push	bx
 22518 00001283 51                      	push	cx
 22519 00001284 52                      	push	dx
 22520 00001285 57                      	push	di
 22521 00001286 56                      	push	si
 22522 00001287 55                      	push	bp
 22523                                  
 22524                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22525                                  
 22526                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22527                                  	; ds = cs
 22528 00001288 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22529 0000128B 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22530                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22531                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22532                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22533 0000128D 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22534                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)

 23351                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23352                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23353                                  
 23354                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23355                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23356                                  
 23357                                  new_init_loop:
 23358                                  
 23359                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23360                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23361                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23362                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23363                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23364                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23365                                  
 23366 00001471 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23367 00001474 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23368 00001476 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23369 0000147A 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23370                                  
 23371 0000147D 1E                      	push	ds
 23372                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23373                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23374                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23375 0000147E B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23376 00001481 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23377 00001483 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23378 00001486 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23379 00001488 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23380 0000148C 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23381 0000148F 1F                      	pop	ds
 23382                                  
 23383 00001490 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23384 00001493 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23385 00001497 C3                      	retn
 23386                                  
 23387                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
