 23619                                  _$P_DOSTBL_BL	   equ	5		;AN000; buffer length for Tbl pointer
 23620                                  _$P_DOSTBL_File	   equ	4		;AN000; get file uppercase table
 23621                                  _$P_DOSTBL_Char	   equ	2		;AN000; get character uppercase table
 23622                                  					; By this call following information
 23623                                  					; is returned.
 23624                                  struc _$P_DOS_TBL
 23625 00000000 ??                       .InfoID: resb 1			;AN000; information id for the table
 23626 00000001 ????                     .Off:	 resw 1				;AN000; offset address of the table
 23627 00000003 ????                     .Seg:	 resw 1				;AN000; segment address of the table
 23628                                  endstruc
 23629                                  
 23630                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23631                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 23632                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 23633                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 23634                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23635                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 23636                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 23637                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 23638                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23639                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 23640                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23641                                  
 23642                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 23643                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 23644 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 23645 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 23646 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 23647                                  endstruc
 23648                                  
 23649                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 23650                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 23651                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 23652                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 23653                                  
 23654                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23655                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 23656                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 23657                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 23658                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 23659                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 23660                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 23661                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 23662                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 23663                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 23664                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 23665                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23666                                  
 23667                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 23668                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23669 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23670 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23671 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23672                                  endstruc
 23673                                  
 23674                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23675                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23676                                  ;
 23677                                  ;
 23678                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23679                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23680                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23681                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23682                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23683                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23684                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23685                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23686                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23687                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23688                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23689                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23690                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23691                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23692                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23693                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23694                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23695                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23696                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23697                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23698                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23699                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23700                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23701                                  ;	   :
 23702                                  ;
 23703                                  ;Note:
 23704                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23705                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23706                                  ;
 23707                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23708                                  ;
 23709                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23710                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23711                                  ;
 23712                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23713                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23714                                  ;
 23715                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23716                                  ;
 23717                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23718                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23719                                  ;
 23720                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23721                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23722                                  ;
 23723                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23724                                  ;
 23725                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23726                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23727                                  ;
 23728                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23729                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23730                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23731                                  ;
 23732                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23733                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23734                                  ;
 23735                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23736                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23737                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23738                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23739                                  
 23740                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23741                                  
 23742                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23743                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23744                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23745                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23746                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23747                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23748                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23749                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23750                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23751                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23752                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23753                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23754                                  
 23755                                  ;**** Function flags
 23756                                  
 23757                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23758                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23759                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23760                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23761                                  
 23762                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23763                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23764 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23765 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23766 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23767 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23768 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23769 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23770                                  endstruc
 23771                                  
 23772                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23773                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23774                                  ;
 23775                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23776                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23777                                  ;	     +-
 23778                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23779                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23780                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23781                                  ;	     |	:
 23782                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23783                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23784                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23785                                  ;	     |	:
 23786                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23787                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23788                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23789                                  ;	     +-	:
 23790                                  ;
 23791                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23792                                  ;
 23793                                  ;Note:
 23794                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23795                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23796                                  ;
 23797                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23798                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23799                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23800                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23801                                  
 23802                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23803                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23804                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23805                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23806                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23807                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23808                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23809                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23810                                  
 23811                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23812 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23813 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23814 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23815 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23816 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23817                                  endstruc
 23818                                  
 23819                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23820                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23821                                  ;
 23822                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23823                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23824                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23825                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23826                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23827                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23828                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23829                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23830                                  ;
 23831                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23832                                  ;
 23833                                  ;            +-
 23834                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23835                                  ;	    | or
 23836                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23837                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23838                                  ;	    | or
 23839                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23840                                  ;	    | or
 23841                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23842                                  ;	    | or
 23843                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23844                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23845                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23846                                  ;	    | or
 23847                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23848                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23849                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23850                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23851                                  ;	    +-
 23852                                  ;
 23853                                  ;
 23854                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23855                                  ;      list.
 23856                                  ;
 23857                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23858                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23859                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23860                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23861                                  
 23862                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 23863                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 23864 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 23865 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 23866 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23867 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23868                                  endstruc
 23869

 23872                                  
 23873                                  _$P_EOL		   equ	0		;AN000; End of line
 23874                                  _$P_Number	   equ	1		;AN000; Number
 23875                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 23876                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 23877                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 23878                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 23879                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 23880                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 23881                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 23882                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 23883

 23885

 23887                                  ;
 23888                                  ; following return code will be returned in the AX register.
 23889

 23891                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 23892                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 23893                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 23894                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 23895                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 23896                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 23897                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 23898                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 23899                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line
 23900

 23981                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991

 23983                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23984                                  
 23985                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23986                                  ; SysParse;
 23987                                  ;
 23988                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23989                                  ;
 23990                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23991                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23992                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23993                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23994                                  ;
 23995                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23996                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23997                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23998                                  ;
 23999                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 24000                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 24001                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 24002                                  ;
 24003                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 24004                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 24005                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 24006                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 24007                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 24008                                  ;
 24009                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24010                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 24011                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 24012                                  ;
 24013                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 24014                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 24015                                  ;
 24016                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 24017                                  ;
 24018                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 24019                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 24020                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 24021                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 24022                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 24023                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 24024                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 24025                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC

 24682                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24683                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24684                                  ;
 24685                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24686                                  ;
 24687                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24688                                  ;	    AL = type
 24689                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24690                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24691                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24692                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24693                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24694                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24695                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24696                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24697                                  ;
 24698                                  ; Output:   None
 24699                                  ;
 24700                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24701                                  ;
 24702                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24703                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24704                                  
 24705                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 24706 0000177B 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24707 0000177C 268B7F04                	mov	di,[es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Result_Buf]
 24708                                  					;AN000; di points to result buffer
 24709 00001780 2E893E[C914]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DX],di		;AC034; set returned result address
 24710                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type],al ;AN000; store type
 24711                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 24712                                  	; 07/09/2023
 24713                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type], ax
 24714 00001785 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax		; store type (al) and item tag (ah)
 24715                                  
 24716 00001788 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24717 00001789 2EA1[D814]              	mov	ax,[cs:_$P_Found_SYNONYM] ;AC034; if yes,
 24718 0000178D 26894502                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],ax 
 24719                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result
 24720 00001791 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24721                                  _$P_RLT04:				;AN000;
 24722 00001792 3C01                    	cmp	al,_$P_Number		;AN000; if number
 24723 00001794 750A                    	jne	short _$P_RLT00		;AN000;
 24724                                  
 24725                                  _$P_RLT02:				;AN000;
 24726 00001796 26895504                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val],dx ;AN000; then store 32bit
 24727 0000179A 26894D06                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val+2],cx ;AN000; number
 24728 0000179E EB5A                    	jmp	short _$P_RLT_Exit	;AN000;
 24729                                  
 24730                                  _$P_RLT00:				;AN000;

 24732 000017A2 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RLT01		;AN000;
 24733

 24735                                  					;AN000; then store list index
 24736 000017A8 EB50                    	jmp	short _$P_RLT_Exit	;AN000;
 24737                                  
 24738                                  _$P_RLT01:				;AN000;
 24739 000017AA 3C07                    	cmp	al,_$P_Date_F		;AN000; Date format ?

 24939

 25099                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25100                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25101                                  ;
 25102                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25103                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25104                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25105                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25106                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25107                                  ;
 25108                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25109                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25110                                  ;
 25111                                  ; Output:    None
 25112                                  ;
 25113                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 25114                                  ;
 25115                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25116                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25117                                  
 25118                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25119                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25120                                  
 25121                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25122                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 25123                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 25124 0000192A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25125 0000192B 2E800E[D114]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 25126 00001931 2E8026[D114]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 25127                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 25128 00001937 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 25129 0000193A 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 25130 0000193C 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 25131                                  
 25132 0000193E 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 25133 00001940 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 25134                                  
 25135 00001942 2E800E[D114]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 25136                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 25137 00001948 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 25138                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 25139 00001949 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 25140 0000194C 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25141 0000194D C3                      	retn
 25142                                  
 25143                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25144                                  
 25145                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25146                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C6Ah)
 25147                                  
 25148                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25149                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 25150 0000194E 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25151 0000194F 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25152 00001950 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25153 00001951 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25154 00001952 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 25155 00001954 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 25156 00001956 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 25157                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 25158 00001957 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 25159 0000195A 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?

 25403                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 25404                                  ;
 25405                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 25406                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 25407                                  ;
 25408                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 25409                                  ;
 25410                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 25411                                  ;
 25412                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 25413                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25414                                  
 25415                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25416                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 25417 00001A2F 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 25418 00001A30 2EF606[D114]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 25419 00001A36 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 25420                                  
 25421 00001A38 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 25422 00001A39 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25423                                  
 25424                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 25425 00001A3A 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 25426 00001A3B 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 25427                                  
 25428 00001A3D F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 25429 00001A3E C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 25430                                  
 25431                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 25432 00001A3F F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 25433 00001A40 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25938                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25939                                  ; _$P_Skip_Delim;
 25940                                  ;
 25941                                  ; Function: Skip delimiters specified in the PARMS list, white space
 25942                                  ;	    and comma.
 25943                                  ;
 25944                                  ; Input:    DS:SI -> Command String
 25945                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25946                                  ;
 25947                                  ; Output:   CY = 1 if the end of line encounterd
 25948                                  ;	    CY = 0 then SI move to 1st non-delimiter character
 25949                                  ;	    AL = Last examineed character
 25950                                  ;
 25951                                  ; Use:	    _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim,
 25952                                  ;
 25953                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 25954                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25955                                  
 25956                                  _$P_Skip_Delim:
 25957                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 25958 00001C19 AC                      	lodsb				;AN000;

 25964

 25967

 25969                                  	;jz	short _$P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; no switch, no keyword (tm08)
 25970                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25971                                  	; cf=0
 25972 00001C32 7505                    	jnz	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit
 25973 00001C34 C3                      	retn
 25974                                  
 25975                                  	;dec	si			;AN000; backup si for next call (tm08)
 25976                                  	;jmp	short _$P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; else exit w/ CY off
 25977                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25978                                  	; cf=0
 25979                                  	; 08/07/2023
 25980                                  	;jmp	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit
 25981

 25991                                  	; 12/12/2022

 25993 00001C3A C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25994

 26000                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26001                                  ; _$P_Chk_EOL;
 26002                                  ;
 26003                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of End of Line characters.
 26004                                  ;
 26005                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26006                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 26007                                  ;
 26008                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of End of Line characters
 26009                                  ;**********************************************************************
 26010                                  
 26011                                  _$P_Chk_EOL:
 26012 00001C3B 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26013 00001C3C 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26014 00001C3D 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; Carriage return ?
 26015 00001C3F 742C                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 26016 00001C41 3C00                    	cmp	al,_$P_NULL		;AN000; zero ?
 26017 00001C43 7428                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 26018                                  ;IF LFEOLSW				;AN028; IF LF TO BE ACCEPTED AS EOL
 26019 00001C45 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?
 26020 00001C47 7424                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 26021                                  ;ENDIF					;AN028;
 26022 00001C49 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_EOL 
 26023                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 26024 00001C4E 721D                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 26025 00001C50 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 26026 00001C52 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 26027                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 26028 00001C56 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 26029                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26030 00001C59 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; *
 26031 00001C5B 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 26032 00001C5F 740B                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 26033                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26034                                  	;;xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra character
 26035                                  	;xor	ch,ch ; *
 26036 00001C61 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; 
 26037                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 26038 00001C64 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 26039 00001C65 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 26040 00001C68 7403                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 26041 00001C6A E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_EOL_Loop 	;AN000;
 26042                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26043                                  	; cx=0
 26044                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ:				;AN000;
 26045                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; reset ZF
 26046                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26047 00001C6C 41                      	inc	cx  ; zf=0  (cx=1) ; *
 26048                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 26049 00001C6D 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26050 00001C6E 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 26051 00001C6F C3                      	retn

 26053                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26054                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 26055                                  ;
 26056                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 26057                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 26058                                  ;	    blanks.
 26059                                  ;
 26060                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26061                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 26062                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 26063                                  ;
 26064                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 26065                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 26066                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 26067                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26068                                  
 26069                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26070                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 26071                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 26072                                  
 26073                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26074 00001C70 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26075 00001C71 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26076 00001C72 2EC606[CB14]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 26077                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 26078                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 26079 00001C78 2E8026[D114]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 26080 00001C7E 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 26081 00001C80 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26082                                  
 26083 00001C82 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 26084 00001C84 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26085                                  
 26086 00001C86 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 26087 00001C88 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26088                                  
 26089                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 26090                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 26091                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26092                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 26093                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 26094                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 26095                                  %if 0
 26096                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26097                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 26098                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 26099                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26100                                  
 26101                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 26102                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26103                                  
 26104                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 26105                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 26106                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 26107                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26108                                  %endif
 26109                                  
 26110                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 26111 00001C8A 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 26112                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 26113 00001C8F 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26114                                  
 26115                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 26116 00001C91 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 26117                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 26118 00001C93 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 26119                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 26120                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 26121                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 26122                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26123 00001C97 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 26124                                  
 26125 00001C99 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 26126                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 26127 00001C9C 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 26128 00001C9D 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 26129 00001CA0 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26130                                  
 26131 00001CA2 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 26132                                  
 26133                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 26134                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 26135                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26136                                  	; cx=0 here
 26137 00001CA4 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 26138                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 26139                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 26140 00001CA5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26141 00001CA6 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 26142 00001CA7 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 26143                                  
 26144                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 26145 00001CA8 2EA2[CB14]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 26146 00001CAC 2EF606[D114]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 26147 00001CB2 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 26148                                  
 26149 00001CB4 2E800E[D114]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 26150                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 26151                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 26152 00001CBA 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 26153 00001CBC EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;

 26155                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26156                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 26157                                  ;
 26158                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 26159                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 26160                                  ;
 26161                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26162                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 26163                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 26164                                  ;
 26165                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 26166                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 26167                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 26168                                  
 26169                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 26170                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 26171                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 26172                                  ;
 26173                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 26174                                  
 26175                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 26176                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26177                                  
 26178                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 26179                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 26180                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 26181                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26182 00001CBE BD[DA14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 26183                                  
 26184                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 26185 00001CC1 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 26186 00001CC3 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 26187                                  
 26188                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 26189 00001CC5 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26190 00001CC7 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 26191                                  
 26192 00001CC9 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 26193                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26194                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26195 00001CCA C3                      	retn
 26196                                  
 26197                                  ; 12/12/2022
 26198                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 26199                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 26200                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26201                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 26202                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26203                                  
 26204                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 26205                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 26206 00001CCB 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26207 00001CCD 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 26208                                  
 26209 00001CCF 2E800E[D114]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 26210                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26211                                  
 26212                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26213                                  	; cf=0
 26214                                  	;retn
 26215                                  
 26216                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 26217                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26218                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 26219 00001CD5 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 26220                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26221                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 26222 00001CD6 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26224                                  ;**************************************************************************
 26225                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26226                                  ;
 26227                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 26228                                  ;
 26229                                  ;  Input:
 26230                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 26231                                  ;
 26232                                  ;  Output:
 26233                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 26234                                  ;
 26235                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 26236                                  ;
 26237                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 26238                                  ;***************************************************************************
 26239                                  
 26240                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26241 00001CD7 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 26242 00001CD8 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 26243 00001CD9 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26244                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 26245                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 26246                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26247 00001CDA 2E8B36[CE14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 26248 00001CDF 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 26249 00001CE1 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 26250 00001CE3 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26251 00001CE4 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26252 00001CE5 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26253 00001CE6 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 26254 00001CE7 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 26255 00001CE8 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 26256 00001CE9 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 26257                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 26258                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 26259 00001CEA 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 26260 00001CEC B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 26261 00001CEF CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 26262                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 26263 00001CF1 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26264 00001CF3 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26265 00001CF5 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 26266 00001CF6 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 26267 00001CF7 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 26268 00001CF8 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 26269 00001CF9 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26270 00001CFA 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26271 00001CFB 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 26272 00001CFC 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 26273                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 26274 00001CFE 2E8936[CC14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 26275 00001D03 2E891E[CE14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 26276                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 26277                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 26278                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 26279                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26280 00001D08 2EC536[CC14]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 26281                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 26282 00001D0D 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 26283 00001D10 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 26284 00001D12 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 26285 00001D14 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 26286 00001D16 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 26287 00001D19 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 26288 00001D1B F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 26289 00001D1C EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 26290                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 26291 00001D1E 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 26292 00001D1F 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 26293                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 26294 00001D20 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 26295                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 26296                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26297                                  	; cf=0
 26298                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 26299                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 26300 00001D22 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26301 00001D23 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 26302 00001D24 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 26303 00001D25 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26317 00000002 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; an extra delimiter list
 26318 00000003 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; length is 1
 26319 00000004 ??                      	resb 	1	; db ';' ; delimiter
 26320                                  .size:
 26321                                  endstruc

 26326 00000004 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; result value buffer

 26329                                  ;  the "result_val" from every structure invocation

 26332 00000008 ??                      	resb	1	; db 0	; no switches/keywords
 26333                                  .size:
 26334                                  endstruc

 26338 00000001 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; 1 definition of range
 26339 00000002 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; item tag for this range
 26340 00000003 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric min
 26341 00000007 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric max
 26342                                  .size:
 26343                                  endstruc

 26866                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 26867                                  
 26868                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26869                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26870                                  
 26871                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26872                                  ;
 26873                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26874                                  ;
 26875                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26876                                  ;
 26877                                  ;   Modification log:
 26878                                  ;
 26879                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26880                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26881                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26882                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26883                                  ;
 26884                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26885                                  ;
 26886                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26887                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26888                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26889                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26890                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26891                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26892                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26893                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26894                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26895                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26896                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26897                                  ;
 26898                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26899                                  
 26900                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26901                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26902                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26903                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26904                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26905                                  
 26906                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26907                                  
 26908                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26909                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26910                                  
 26911                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26912                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26913                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26914                                  
 26915                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26916                                  ;
 26917                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26918                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26919                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 26920                                  ;	           line.
 26921                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26922                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26923                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26924                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26925                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26926                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26927                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 26928                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26929                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26930                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26931                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26932                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26933                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26934                                  ;	           for details).
 26935                                  
 26936 00001F25 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 26937 00001F26 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 26938 00001F27 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 26939 00001F29 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 26940 00001F2A 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26941 00001F3A 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26942 00001F5A 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 26943 00001F5B 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 26944 00001F5C 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 26945                                  
 26946                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26947                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26948                                  
 26949                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26950                                  
 26951                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26952

 27078                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27079                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27080                                  ;
 27081                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 27082                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 27083                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 27084                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 27085                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 27086                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 27087                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 27088                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 27089                                  ;
 27090 00001FD8 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 27091 00001FD9 8916[B614]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 27092 00001FDD 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 27093                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG

 27132 00002001 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars

 27261 0000207B 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 27262 0000207D E8AC21                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 27263 00002080 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 27264 00002082 A3[AF02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 27265 00002085 58                              pop     ax
 27266                                  ;
 27267                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 27268                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 27269                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 27270                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 27271                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 27272                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 27273                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 27274                                  ;   spot.
 27275                                  ;
 27276                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 27277                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 27278                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 27279                                  ;   retrieved.
 27280                                  ;
 27281 00002086 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 27282 0000208B 7211                            jb	short not_final		; no
 27283                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 27284 0000208D F606[CE02]01            	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27285 00002092 7407                            jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 27286 00002094 803E[CD02]03                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 27287 00002099 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no
 27288                                  final:                                  ;
 27289 0000209B 268804                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 27290                                  not_final:                              ;
 27291                                  ;endif
 27292                                  
 27293                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27294                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27295                                  
 27296 0000209E 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 27297 000020A0 E88921                  	call	getchr
 27298 000020A3 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 27299                                  
 27300 000020A5 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 27301                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 27302                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27303 000020AA 7380                    	jnb	short endconv	
 27304 000020AC E95408                  	jmp	badop
 27305                                  	
 27306                                  coff:	
 27307                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27308                                  	; ds = cs
 27309                                  	;push	cs
 27310                                  	;pop	ds

 27313                                  
 27314                                  blank_line:
 27315 000020B4 E87521                  	call	getchr
 27316 000020B7 EB9F                    	jmp	short conflp

 27318                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27319                                  ; 11/12/2022
 27320                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)

 27322                                  	;push	cs
 27323                                  	;pop	ds
 27324                                  
 27325                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 27326                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 27327                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 27328                                  ;install= command.

 27331                                  ;install command

 27363                                  ;       but don't process them now.

 27480                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27481                                  ;									      *
 27482                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27483                                  ;									      *
 27484                                  ; input :								      *
 27485                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27486                                  ; output:								      *
 27487                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27488                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 27489                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 27490                                  ;									      *
 27491                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27492                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27493                                  ; logic:								      *
 27494                                  ; {									      *
 27495                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 27496                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27497                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 27498                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27499                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27500                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27501                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 27502                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 27503                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 27504                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 27505                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 27506                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 27507                                  ;	};								      *
 27508                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 27509                                  ; };									      *
 27510                                  ;									      *
 27511                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27512                                  
 27513                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27514                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 27515                                  tryb:
 27516 00002152 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 27517 00002155 755C                    	jne	short tryc
 27518                                  
 27519                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27520                                  ; (SYSINIT:24BFh)

 27522                                  ;%if 0
 27523                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG

 27526                                  ;endif
 27527                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27528

 27530                                  	; 18/12/2022

 27552                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 27553 00002172 813E[711D][661D]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x
