 27602                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27603                                  ; break command
 27604                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27605                                  
 27606                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27607                                  ;									    *
 27608                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 27609                                  ;									    *
 27610                                  ; input :								    *
 27611                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 27612                                  ; output:								    *
 27613                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 27614                                  ;									    *
 27615                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 27616                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 27617                                  ; logic:								    *
 27618                                  ; {									    *
 27619                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 27620                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 27621                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 27622                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 27623                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 27624                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 27625                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 27626                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 27627                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 27628                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 27629                                  ;	};								    *
 27630                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 27631                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 27632                                  ; };									    *
 27633                                  ;									    *
 27634                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27635                                  
 27636                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27637                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)
 27638                                  tryc:
 27639 000021B3 80FC43                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BREAK ; 'C'
 27640 000021B6 7539                    	jne	short trym
 27641                                  
 27642                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27643                                  ; (SYSINIT:2527h)
 27644                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27645                                  ;%if 0
 27646                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27647 000021B8 E8DE1E                  	call	query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27648 000021BB 7234                    	jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27649                                  ;endif
 27650                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27651                                  
 27652 000021BD BF[771D]                	mov	di,brk_parms
 27653 000021C0 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27654                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27655                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 27656                                  do22:
 27657 000021C2 E81F07                  	call	sysinit_parse
 27658 000021C5 7303                    	jnc	short if22		; parse error
 27659                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  show message and end the search loop.
 27660                                  	;;jmp	short sr22
 27661                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27662                                  ;sr22:
 27663                                  	;jmp	coff
 27664                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27665 000021C7 E94906                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27666                                  if22:
 27667 000021CA 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL		; end of line?
 27668 000021CD 7415                    	je	short en22		; then end the $endloop
 27669                                  
 27670                                  	;cmp	byte [result_val_itag],1
 27671 000021CF 803E[701D]01            	cmp	byte [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],1
 27672 000021D4 7507                    	jne	short if26
 27673                                  
 27674 000021D6 C606[9C1D]01            	mov	byte [p_ctrl_break],1	; turn it on
 27675                                  	;jmp	short en26
 27676                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27677 000021DB EBE5                    	jmp	short do22
 27678                                  if26:
 27679 000021DD C606[9C1D]00            	mov	byte [p_ctrl_break],0	; turn it off
 27680                                  en26:
 27681 000021E2 EBDE                    	jmp	short do22		; we actually set the ctrl break
 27682                                  en22:
 27683 000021E4 B433                    	mov	ah,SET_CTRL_C_TRAPPING ; if we don't have any parse error.
 27684 000021E6 B001                    	mov	al,1
 27685 000021E8 8A16[9C1D]              	mov	dl,[p_ctrl_break]
 27686 000021EC CD21                    	int	21h
 27687                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27688                                  	;jmp	short sr22
 27689                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27690                                  sr22:
 27691 000021EE E9BEFE                  	jmp	coff

 27693                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27694                                  ; multitrack command
 27695                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27696                                  
 27697                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27698                                  ;									      *
 27699                                  ; function: parse the parameters of multitrack= command.		      *
 27700                                  ;									      *
 27701                                  ; input :								      *
 27702                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27703                                  ; output:								      *
 27704                                  ;	turn multrk_flag on or off.					      *
 27705                                  ;									      *
 27706                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27707                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27708                                  ; logic:								      *
 27709                                  ; {									      *
 27710                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						      *
 27711                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27712                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27713                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27714                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27715                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */   *
 27716                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,on;					      *
 27717                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */   *
 27718                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,off;					      *

 29215                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29216                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 29217                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 29218                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 29219                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 29220                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 29221                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 29222                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 29223                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29224                                  
 29225                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29226                                  ;									  *
 29227                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 29228                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 29229                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 29230                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 29231                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 29232                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 29233                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 29234                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 29235                                  ; input :								  *
 29236                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 29237                                  ; output:								  *
 29238                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 29239                                  ;									  *
 29240                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 29241                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 29242                                  ; logic:								  *
 29243                                  ; {									  *
 29244                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 29245                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 29246                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 29247                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 29248                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 29249                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 29250                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29251                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 29252                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29253                                  ;	     }								  *
 29254                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 29255                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 29256                                  ;	};								  *
 29257                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 29258                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 29259                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 29260                                  ; };									  *
 29261                                  ;**************************************************************************

 29605                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29606                                  ; fcbs command
 29607                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29608                                  
 29609                                  ;************************************************************************
 29610                                  ; function: parse the parameters of fcbs= command.			*
 29611                                  ;									*
 29612                                  ; input :								*
 29613                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				*
 29614                                  ; output:								*
 29615                                  ;	set the variables fcbs,keep.					*
 29616                                  ;									*
 29617                                  ; subroutines to be called:						*
 29618                                  ;	sysinit_parse							*
 29619                                  ; logic:								*
 29620                                  ; {									*
 29621                                  ;	set di points to fcbs_parms;					*
 29622                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						*
 29623                                  ;	while (end of command line)					*
 29624                                  ;	{ sysparse;							*
 29625                                  ;	  if (no error) then						*
 29626                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = fcbs */		*
 29627                                  ;		   fcbs = result_val._$P_picked_val;			*

 30021                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 30022                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 30023                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 30024                                  ;	 procedure.

 30028                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand

 30374                                  ;
 30375                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 30376                                  ;
 30377                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 30378                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 30379                                  ;
 30380                                  ;	Output : none
 30381                                  ;
 30382                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 30383                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 30384                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30385                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 30386                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30387                                  ;
 30388                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30389

 30391                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30392                                  	; ds = cs

 30395                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 30396 0000298C E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 30397 0000298F 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 30398                                  	; 13/05/2019
 30399                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 30400                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 30401                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 30402                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30403                                  	; ds = cs
 30404 00002991 803E[7B1F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 30405 00002996 74F0                    	je	short limx
 30406 00002998 A1[611F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 30407                                  lim_set:
 30408                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 30409                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30410                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 30411                                  ;limx:
 30412                                  	;retn
 30413                                  	
 30414                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 30415                                  
 30416                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30417                                  ;
 30418                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 30419                                  ;
 30420                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 30421                                  ;	Output : none
 30422                                  ;
 30423                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 30424                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 30425                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 30426                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 30427                                  ;
 30428                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30429                                  
 30430                                  	; 01/11/2022
 30431                                  SetInt12Mem:
 30432 0000299B 1E                      	push	ds
 30433 0000299C BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 30434 0000299F 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 30435 000029A1 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 30436 000029A5 2E891E[7F1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 30437 000029AA B106                    	mov	cl,6
 30438 000029AC D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 30439 000029AE A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 30440 000029B1 2EC606[7E1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 30441 000029B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 30442                                  ;limx:
 30443 000029B8 C3                      	retn
 30444                                  
 30445                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30446                                  ;
 30447                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 30448                                  ;
 30449                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 30450                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 30451                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 30452                                  ;
 30453                                  ;	Output : none
 30454                                  ;

 30456                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying

 30466                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 30467 000029BE 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 30468                                  	; 18/12/2022
 30469 000029C0 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 30470 000029C3 8826[7E1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 30471                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30472                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0

 30474                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 30475 000029C8 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 30476 000029CA 2EA1[7F1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]

 30478 000029D1 1F                      	pop	ds
 30479                                  timx:
 30480 000029D2 C3                      	retn

 30533                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30534                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30535                                  
 30536                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 30537                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 30538                                  
 30539                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30540                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 30541                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30542                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30543                                  
 30544                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30545                                  ;
 30546                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 30547                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 30548                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 30549                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 30550                                  ;
 30551                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 30552                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 30553                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 30554                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 30555                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 30556                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 30557                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 30558                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 30559                                  ; available during the load.
 30560                                  ;
 30561                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 30562                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 30563                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 30564                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 30565                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 30566                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 30567                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 30568                                  ;
 30569                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 30570                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 30571                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 30572                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 30573                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 30574                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 30575                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 30576                                  ;
 30577                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30578                                  
 30579                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30580                                  
 30581                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30582                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30583                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30584                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30585                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30586                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30587                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30588                                  
 30589                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30590                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30591                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30592                                  
 30593                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30594                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30595                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30596                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30597                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30598                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30599                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30600                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30601                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 30602                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30603                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30604                                  
 30605                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30606                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30607                                  
 30608                                  InitVar:
 30609                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30610                                  	; ds = cs
 30611                                  
 30612                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 30613                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30614                                  	;push	ax
 30615                                  	;push	cx
 30616                                  	;push	di
 30617 000029FD 06                      	push	es
 30618                                  
 30619                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 30620 000029FE 0E                      	push	cs
 30621 000029FF 07                      	pop	es
 30622                                  
 30623 00002A00 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30624                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30625                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30626                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30627                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30628                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30629                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 30630                                  
 30631                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30632                                  	; ds = cs
 30633 00002A02 A2[261F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30634 00002A05 A2[251F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30635 00002A08 A3[271F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30636 00002A0B C606[291F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30637                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30638 00002A10 A2[5C1F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 30639                                  
 30640 00002A13 FC                      	cld
 30641                                  
 30642 00002A14 B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 30643 00002A17 BF[2A1F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 30644 00002A1A F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 30645                                  
 30646                                  	;mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 30647                                  	; 01/01/2033
 30648 00002A1C B110                    	mov	cl,MAXUMB ; 16
 30649 00002A1E BF[3A1F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 30650 00002A21 F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 30651                                  
 30652                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 30653                                  
 30654                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 30655 00002A23 07                      	pop	es
 30656                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30657                                  	;pop	di
 30658                                  	;pop	cx
 30659                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 30660                                  
 30661 00002A24 C3                      	retn
 30662                                  
 30663                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30664                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30665                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30666                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30667                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30668                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30669                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30670                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30671                                  
 30672                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30673                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 30674                                  FixMem:
 30675                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30676                                  	;push	ax
 30677                                  	;push	bx
 30678                                  	;push	cx
 30679                                  	;push	dx
 30680 00002A25 06                      	push	es
 30681                                  
 30682 00002A26 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30683                                  
 30684 00002A29 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30685 00002A2C 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30686                                  
 30687 00002A2E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30688                                  
 30689                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30690                                  
 30691 00002A30 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30692 00002A32 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30693 00002A34 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30694                                  
 30695                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30696                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30697                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30698                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30699                                  
 30700 00002A35 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30701 00002A39 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30702 00002A3E 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30703 00002A40 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30704                                  
 30705                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30706                                  
 30707 00002A42 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30708 00002A47 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30709 00002A49 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30710                                  
 30711 00002A4D 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30712                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30713                                  	; 11/07/2023
 30714 00002A52 43                      	inc	bx
 30715 00002A53 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30716                                  
 30717                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30718                                  
 30719 00002A58 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 30720 00002A5A 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30721                                  
 30722 00002A5F 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30723 00002A61 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30724 00002A66 43                      	inc	bx
 30725 00002A67 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 30726                                  
 30727                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30728 00002A69 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30729 00002A6B 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30730                                  fmX:	
 30731 00002A6D E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30732                                  
 30733 00002A70 07                      	pop	es
 30734                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30735                                  	;pop	dx
 30736                                  	;pop	cx
 30737                                  	;pop	bx
 30738                                  	;pop	ax
 30739                                  
 30740 00002A71 C3                      	retn
 30741                                  
 30742                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30743                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 30744                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30745                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30746                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 30747                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30748                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 30749                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30750                                  
 30751                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30752                                  fm_link:
 30753 00002A72 B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 30754 00002A75 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 30755                                  
 30756                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 30757                                  	;
 30758                                  	;push	es
 30759                                  	;push	cs
 30760                                  	;pop	es
 30761                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 30762                                  	;pop	es
 30763                                  	
 30764                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30765                                  	; ds = cs
 30766                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 30767 00002A77 A2[5A1F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 30768                                  
 30769 00002A7A B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30770 00002A7D BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 30771 00002A80 CD21                    	int	21h
 30772 00002A82 C3                      	retn
 30773                                  
 30774                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30775                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 30776                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30777                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 30778                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30779                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30780                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 30781                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30782                                  
 30783                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30784                                  fm_unlink:
 30785 00002A83 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 30786                                  	
 30787                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 30788                                  	;
 30789                                  	;push	ds
 30790                                  	;push	cs
 30791                                  	;pop	ds
 30792                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 30793                                  	;pop	ds
 30794                                  	
 30795                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30796                                  	; ds = cs
 30797                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 30798 00002A85 8A1E[5A1F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 30799                                  
 30800 00002A89 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30801 00002A8C CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 30802 00002A8E C3                      	retn
 30803                                  
 30804                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30805                                  
 30806                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30807                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30808                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30809                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30810                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30811                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30812                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30813                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30814                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30815                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30816                                  ;
 30817                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30818                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30819                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30820                                  ;
 30821                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30822                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30823                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30824                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30825                                  ;
 30826                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30827                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30828                                  ;
 30829                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30830                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30831                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30832                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30833                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30834                                  ;     lh
 30835                                  ;     /l
 30836                                  ;     1
 30837                                  ;     1000
 30838                                  ;     2
 30839                                  ;     print
 30840                                  ;     /d
 30841                                  ;     :lpt2
 30842                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 30843                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 30844                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 30845                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 30846                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 30847                                  ; for:
 30848                                  ;    Each /L
 30849                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 30850                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 30851                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 30852                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 30853                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 30854                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30855                                  
 30856                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30857                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 30858                                  
 30859                                  ParseVar:
 30860                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 30861                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30862                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30863 00002A8F 1E                      	push	ds
 30864 00002A90 06                      	push	es
 30865                                  
 30866 00002A91 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 30867 00002A92 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 30868 00002A93 FC                      	cld
 30869                                  
 30870                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30871                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 30872                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30873                                  
 30874 00002A94 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 30875 00002A95 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 30876 00002A98 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 30877                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30878 00002A9A 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 30879 00002A9C 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 30880                                  
 30881 00002A9E 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 30882 00002A9F F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 30883 00002AA0 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 30884                                  
 30885 00002AA2 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 30886                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 30887 00002AA3 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 30888                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 30889 00002AA5 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 30890 00002AA7 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 30891                                  
 30892                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30893 00002AA9 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30894                                  
 30895                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 30896                                  	;
 30897                                  	;push	es
 30898                                  	;push	cs
 30899                                  	;pop	es
 30900                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 30901                                  	;pop	es
 30902                                  
 30903 00002AAE 2EC606[261F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 30904                                  
 30905 00002AB4 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 30906                                  
 30907                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 30908 00002AB6 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 30909 00002AB8 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 30910                                  
 30911                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30912 00002ABA 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30913                                  
 30914 00002ABF E80E00                  	call	parseL
 30915 00002AC2 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 30916                                  
 30917 00002AC4 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 30918 00002AC5 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 30919                                  
 30920                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 30921 00002AC7 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30922 00002ACA 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 30923 00002ACB 4E                      	dec	si
 30924 00002ACC F9                      	stc
 30925                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 30926 00002ACD 07                      	pop	es
 30927 00002ACE 1F                      	pop	ds
 30928                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30929                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30930 00002ACF C3                      	retn
 30931                                  
 30932                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30933                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 30934                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30935                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 30936                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 30937                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 30938                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 30939                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30940                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 30941                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 30942                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 30943                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 30944                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30945                                  
 30946                                  parseL:
 30947 00002AD0 AC                      	lodsb
 30948 00002AD1 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 30949 00002AD3 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 30950                                  
 30951                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30952                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 30953                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30954                                  
 30955 00002AD5 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 30956 00002AD8 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 30957 00002ADA E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 30958                                  
 30959 00002ADD 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 30960 00002ADF E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 30961 00002AE2 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 30962                                  
 30963                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 30964 00002AE4 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30965                                  
 30966 00002AE9 AC                      	lodsb
 30967 00002AEA 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 30968 00002AEC 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 30969                                  
 30970 00002AEE E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 30971 00002AF1 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 30972                                  
 30973 00002AF3 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 30974 00002AF6 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30975                                  
 30976                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30977 00002AF8 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 30978 00002AFA 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 30979                                  
 30980 00002AFC 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 30981 00002AFE 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 30982                                  
 30983                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 30984                                  
 30985 00002B00 E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 30986 00002B03 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 30987                                  
 30988 00002B05 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 30989                                  
 30990 00002B08 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 30991                                  
 30992                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 30993 00002B0B 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30994                                  
 30995 00002B10 AC                      	lodsb
 30996 00002B11 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 30997 00002B13 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 30998                                  
 30999 00002B15 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 31000 00002B18 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 31001                                  
 31002 00002B1A E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 31003 00002B1D 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31004                                  
 31005                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31006 00002B1F 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 31007 00002B21 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 31008                                  plE1:	
 31009                                  	;mov	ax,1
 31010 00002B23 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 31011 00002B26 4E                      	dec	si
 31012 00002B27 F9                      	stc
 31013 00002B28 C3                      	retn
 31014                                  
 31015                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 31016 00002B29 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 31017                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31018                                  	; cf=1
 31019                                  	;stc
 31020 00002B2C C3                      	retn
 31021                                  plSwX:	
 31022 00002B2D 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 31023                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 31024                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 31025                                  	; cf=0
 31026                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 31027 00002B2E C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 31028                                  
 31029                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31030                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 31031                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 31036                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31037

 31054                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31055                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31056                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31057                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31058                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31059                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31060                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31061                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31062                                  
 31063                                  isEOL:
 31064 00002B2F 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 31065 00002B31 7406                    	je	short ieX
 31066 00002B33 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 31067 00002B35 7402                    	je	short ieX
 31068 00002B37 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 31069                                  ieX:	
 31070 00002B39 C3                      	retn
 31071                                  
 31072                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31073                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 31074                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31075                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31076                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 31077                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31078                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31079                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31080                                  
 31081                                  isWhite:
 31082 00002B3A 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 31083 00002B3C 7406                    	je	short iwX
 31084 00002B3E 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 31085 00002B40 7402                    	je	short iwX
 31086 00002B42 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 31087                                  iwX:	
 31088 00002B44 C3                      	retn
 31089                                  
 31090                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31091                                  ;*** unMarkUMB - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 31092                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31093                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number
 31094                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31095                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31096                                  ; USES:     Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31097                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31098                                  
 31099                                  	; 02/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31100                                  
 31101                                  unMarkUMB:

 31105                                  	;push	di

 31141                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31142                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 31143                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 31144                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 31145                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 31146                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31147                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 31148                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31149                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 31150                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc

 31154                                  stowUMB:

 31156 00002B5A 7202                    	jb	short su10

 31166                                  	;push	cs

 31176 00002B64 7504                    	jne	short su20
 31177 00002B66 2EA2[291F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.

 31254                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31255                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 31256                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 31257                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 31258                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 31259                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31260                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 31261                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 31262                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 31263                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 31264                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31265                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 31266                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 31267                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 31268                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31269                                  
 31270                                  gnradix:
 31271 00002B7D 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 31272                                  
 31273                                  toDigit:
 31274 00002B7F 2E833E[7D2B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 31275 00002B85 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 31276                                  
 31277                                  toDigit_hex:
 31278 00002B87 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 31279 00002B8A 7209                    	jb	short td10
 31280 00002B8C 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 31281 00002B8F 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 31282 00002B91 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 31283                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31284 00002B94 C3                      	retn
 31285                                  td10:	
 31286 00002B95 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 31287 00002B98 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 31288 00002B9A 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 31289 00002B9D 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 31290 00002B9F 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 31291                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31292 00002BA2 C3                      	retn
 31293                                  toDigit_dec:
 31294                                  td20:	
 31295 00002BA3 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 31296                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 31297 00002BA6 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 31298 00002BA8 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 31299 00002BAB 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 31300 00002BAD 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 31301                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31302 00002BB0 C3                      	retn
 31303                                  tdE:	
 31304 00002BB1 F9                      	stc
 31305                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 31306 00002BB2 C3                      	retn
 31307                                  
 31308                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31309                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 31310                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31311                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 31312                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 31313                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 31314                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 31315                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31316                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 31317                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 31318                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 31319                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31320                                  
 31321                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31322                                  
 31323                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31324                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 31325                                  
 31326                                  GetXNum:
 31327                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 31328                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31329                                  	;push	bx
 31330 00002BB3 51                      	push	cx ; *
 31331                                  	;push	ds
 31332                                  
 31333 00002BB4 FC                      	cld
 31334 00002BB5 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 31335 00002BB7 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 31336 00002BB9 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 31337 00002BBB 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 31338                                  
 31339 00002BBD 2EC706[7D2B]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 31340                                  
 31341 00002BC4 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 31342                                  	;call	toDigit
 31343 00002BC7 E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 31344                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 31345                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31346 00002BCA 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 31347                                  
 31348 00002BCC 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 31349 00002BCE 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 31350 00002BD0 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 31351 00002BD4 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 31352 00002BD7 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 31353 00002BD9 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 31354 00002BDC 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 31355                                  
 31356                                  gxn10:	
 31357 00002BDE 2EC706[7D2B]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 31358 00002BE5 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 31359 00002BE6 46                      	inc	si
 31360                                  
 31361                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31362                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 31363                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 31364                                  ;        BX    = 0
 31365                                  ;        CH    = 0
 31366                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31367                                  
 31368                                  gxn20:	
 31369 00002BE7 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 31370 00002BEA 46                      	inc	si
 31371                                  
 31372 00002BEB E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 31373 00002BEE 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 31374                                  
 31375 00002BF0 E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 31376 00002BF3 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 31377                                  
 31378 00002BF5 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 31379 00002BF7 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 31380                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 31381                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 31382 00002BF9 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 31383                                  gxnE:	
 31384                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 31385 00002BFB EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 31386                                  gxnQ:	
 31387 00002BFD 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 31388 00002BFE F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 31389                                  gxnX:	
 31390                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31391                                  	;pop	ds
 31392 00002BFF 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 31393                                  	;pop	bx
 31394 00002C00 C3                      	retn
 31395                                  
 31396                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31397                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 31398                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31399                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 31400                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 31401                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 31402                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31403                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31404                                  
 31405                                  mul32:
 31406 00002C01 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31407 00002C02 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31408 00002C04 2EF726[7D2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31409 00002C09 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 31410                                  
 31411 00002C0B 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31412 00002C0D 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31413                                  
 31414 00002C0E 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31415 00002C10 2EF726[7D2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31416 00002C15 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31417 00002C17 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31418 00002C19 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31419 00002C1B C3                      	retn
 31420                                  m32E:	
 31421 00002C1C 58                      	pop	ax
 31422 00002C1D C3                      	retn
 31423                                  
 31424                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31425                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)

 31442 00002C23 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 31443 00002C24 B10C                    	mov	cl,12

 31445 00002C28 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 31446

 31450                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31451                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 31452                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31453                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 31454                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 31455                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 31456                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX

 31459                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 31460                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 31461                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 31462                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
